Content: everything else is awful
Title: Best streaming service by far

Content: The shows and movies are great and everything and easy to find things but when I try to use it one my phone app can’t download or see the next episode in series (goes to black)
Title: Good but

Content: I’m glad I can use this app with my projector. I don’t have a tv yet. I was going to cancel my subscription because of it.
Title: Projected

Content: Great quality content. Horrible interface (and name). But definitely a must have streaming service after Netflix.
Title: Great selection, bad interface

Content: Performance of the app is slightly better than previous HBO app. There is no synch between downloaded movies/series and movies on front page for instance…the TV app from Apple is the leading app in that space
Title: Quality of the app left to desire

Content: i download this app for the mobile version and i can’t even do anything. i logged in already and try to connect to the cable or provider but it keeps saying error. i deleted and re-downloaded twice and it’s the same thing. i can click on the profiles and change settings but i can’t even watch anything or even go to the home page. i also tried updating but it still doesn’t work. i’m connecting to the internet and have a paid subscription. i don’t know what’s happening but for now i can only watch max on the tv.
Title: can’t do anything “error”

Content: I hope they fix this soon but when you pause something it reverses like 10 mins it’s the most annoying and frustrating thing.
Title: Glitch

Content: It has no ads has all the best shows and doesn’t block stuff for premium
Title: Why max is good

Content: When you finish an episode it doesn’t restart next time you watch it. Every episode it starts at the end, and if you have auto next episode it quickly moves to the next episode. Easiest thing to do with this app is start at the prior episode of the one you want to see. So dumb.
Title: Episodes never start over

Content: Ever since the app has switched over to just “max” it’s been nothing but issues. I pay for this app because of a few of the titles they hold, but honestly it’s getting to a point where it’s not even worth the hassle.
Title: They should have left it how it was

Content: Warner Bros/Discovery CEO David Zaslav has been ruining the company and user experience since day one of his tenure. HBO Max used to be the crème de la crème of streaming, but now it’s just another generic, repetitive and unnavigable app. Why he devalued his own brand by removing the HBO from HBO Max is beyond rational explanation. My yearly membership expires in a month and I won’t be giving another dime to WB/Discovery until that miscreant is out.
Title: The once great app is over

Content: This app has repeatedly made me go and find shows I’m currently watching. And even after finding it I have to find the last episode I was on. It has not been saving my currently watching for multiple shows/movies.
Title: Not a good streamline from the last app

Content: This app is the buggiest streaming app I’ve ever used. Forced off an app that worked perfectly fine and now I can’t even watch a movie on my tv without assisted audio commentary. No way to switch that off from my phone. When trying from a desktop, it’s refused to play in anything other than Portuguese.
Title: Buggy piece of junk

Content: I’m really excited to have to download new apps on ALL my hardware, just to have to wake my bf up and ask him what the blasted login info is… k where’s my list? All this so you can stand out less? Greeeeeaaaat company move. Maybe I just don’t feel like not making sure my auto pay doesn’t go through. Byeeeeee home box office hellooooooooooooo dog tags
Title: Name change

Content: Great app and show choice. I miss the purple logo though. Blue makes it look like every other streaming platform. I’ve mistaken it for Disney once before, lol.
Title: I miss the purple!

Content: I’ve been disappointed with the functionality and lack of user friendliness of the update. Is it truly that hard to make a user friendly option to reset a series so you can rewatch like other platforms use?
Title: Disappointed

Content: This is the one streaming app that should be automatically added to your favorites. It’s HBO and Max! If you know what I mean you know!
Title: The One and Only

Content: Everybody loved HBO then it became HBO Max then Max. What a waste. It’s a good app. They downgraded it with this update. Can’t even add custom pictures for your profiles anymore which was one of my favorite features. They’re slowly starting to add more and more ads. Starting to lose my respect.
Title: Bad Rebrand

Content: Since changing to Max from HBO Max the app will no longer hold my progression in a show if I stop watching and try to resume later. love the app other than this, would love if the issue could be fixed though.
Title: New app

Content: When I cast this app to my tv it automatically changes the language to Spanish and it won’t let my change it.  The app is fine when I watch something on my phone.
Title: Automatic Language change

Content: Nice they included a lot more shows than before
Title: More content same price

Content: Not only do you lose all of your previous watched movies and tv shows, you have to make your profile all over again!! 😤 It’s like deleting your HBO Max account for just MAX. So stupid. Whoever decided that this was a good idea, needs to be fired; All of them.   ALSO! It signs me out every time I close the app on my tv or my phone.
Title: So frustrating!!! 0 stars

Content: I loved it when it was just hbo max but now it’s just max like I get but oven been having problems trying to watch something it freezes then loads again then tells me something went wrong. It’s literally on everything I try to watch. All I wanted is to watch a show and not have problems
Title: I don’t even know

Content: App works great no problems other than the fact that it doesn’t have as wide of a selection as I would like for a five star rating.
Title: 4 stars

Content: I was already irritated that they made a whole separate app for HBO rather than just updating the existing one, but tonight I discovered the SharePlay feature to watch together over FaceTime was not carried over to the new app.  I’ll update my review if they bring it back but this was a huge disappointment
Title: Lacking SharePlay functionality that the old app had

Content: Which is my go to on a daily basis. It’s constantly bringing back shows/movies I’ve clearly finished to the end or have deliberately hit the remove button. And shows/movies that I’m still in progress on are never in Continue Watching. And I’ve observed this on iOS, my Apple TV, and my Roku TV.   Super frustrating.
Title: Continue Watching is broken

Content: The app works sometimes. The skip forward button is janky, only working some of the times. And half the time when I try to watch it gets stuck on a loop the first 5 seconds of a show.
Title: It’s alright

Content: The team that decided that this app was ready for release should be fired. This app update is a downgrade. The Max app is missing key iOS features that were supported by the HBO app like AppleTV Up Next, which is particularly unpleasant on AppleTV.  I’ve been getting HBO Max with my AT&T subscription, but honestly I’ll probably go shopping for better cell phone plans as I plan to drop Max.
Title: Fire David Zazlav

Content: Who came up with “Max”? Honestly, if they rename the company to HBO, that would be much better. If you Google “Max”, you will see so many result not related to HBO Max but if you Google HBO, you will find almost all results related to HBO Max.
Title: Max? Seriously?

Content: Me and my bf used to love this app but the new app took away a key feature we enjoyed using which was share play during FaceTime calls when we’re away from each other. We’re so disappointed :(
Title: New App Regressed

Content: I’m really enjoying MAX. The convenience of being able to lay on my bed & wath a wide variety of options is GREAT. Movies, Series whatever, makes my day more enjoyable & easier.
Title: MAX is GREAT

Content: I am an Apple ecosystem person but I have to say with the added programs to HBO now Max is the best value for the money. Original shows and movies and tv show make it hands down a must have.
Title: Max is the best.

Content: The new app is not saving my progress. It’s very annoying to have to go to the show I’m currently watching and try to remember which episode I left off on every time. Hope this gets fixed soon or I may have to cancel my subscription.
Title: Not saving progress

Content: What was even the point, making people delete the old app for this new one for no reason. It doesn’t take a degree is business to realize that spending all that money on a rebrand and developing a whole new app just to confuse people and ultimately lose a percentage of subscribers was a bad decision. There’s no way you people don’t fire whoever’s idea this was
Title: Worst Rebrand Ever

Content: Just wished that HBO would show more academy award movies that have been nominated for their excellence. I still like most of HBO’s original programming, especially the classics like Game of Thrones, Deadwood and The Sopranos.
Title: HBO programming

Content: You are the best app on my phone and I use you every single day I love South Park and all the other shows you are doing good keep it up 👍
Title: Thank you

Content: There was no reason to shut down the HBO app and force everyone to start using this. If they truly wanted to combine their brands then why is the Discovery + still a thing while the HBO app was shut down. A stupid decision made by an out of touch CEO that doesn’t understand their subscriber base of the value of the HBO brand that has provided years of incredibly well made TV.
Title: Just Why

Content: I hate the fact that on my TV (Roku) I can’t really see the selection, so I can’t see the movie I want to select, or for some shows… I love south park, I can’t even see what season I am selecting; it is not highlighted or nothing! Crap crap crappy Max, I loved my HBO
Title: Some issues

Content: I love HBO. I don’t love discovery and all these other things that come with Max. I do not want to pay for Max when I’m only watching things on the HBO lineup. I will be canceling my subscription and if you agree with my opinion you should too. The executives should know that nobody wants to pay more money for a bundle they don’t use!
Title: Max is a complete departure from what HBOMax set out to be

Content: I mean, c’mon. Really? Let’s remove the only thing that keeps us separated from the pack (“HBO”) and change the color to match most-other streaming services in hopes that people, at least the ones who aren’t colorblind, will click on it because it’s blue.   It’s sad that this is what HBO has come to. I will not be renewing my subscription.
Title: Worst Marketing Decision In the History of Streaming

Content: It has a lot of options to watch and it has a lot of shows and movies to watch that most networks don’t.😃😉
Title: HBO max

Content: New app is apparently bugged. Can't sign in. Would have been better and more practical (not factoring in multi billion dollar nonsense) to update last app, which worked like a charm. "Max annoyance". The split second my kids don't like what's offered any more it's getting chopped. You call yourself Max but the rest of us will still shorten it to HBO. Bad move WB😑
Title: New and not improved

Content: I am really disappointed that the show I have been streaming recently was taken off MAX once the change was made from HBO MAX. I had been watching the fictional TV show Without a Trace and now the only place I can watch it is to pay for it on a another streaming site. So much for making the experience better.
Title: My show taken off

Content: I switched plans just so I could watch a show with my girlfriend because it wouldn’t let me with the basic plan. Now with this new “MAX” I can’t enjoy movies or shows with my girlfriend over FaceTime. I switched over for that reason because it made me, now Im paying for nothing as i can’t do it anymore. so whats the reason?
Title: Issue with share play

Content: This app is a major step back from the old HBOMax app. Aside from shamelessly ripping off the AppleTV app UX, the Apple video player has once again been replaced with an inferior proprietary one: gone are Up Next support, HDR, jog on the Siri Remote, Picture in Picture and “What did he say?” via Siri. This is an utter disaster that makes me want to cancel my subscription.
Title: Terrible app fails to showcase decent content

Content: Screw David Zaslov and Discovery. Purging content, devaluing creatives, over extending to buy HBO and then immediately starting to slash and burn to compensate. This is not a partnership anyone needed or asked for. No one cares about Discovery’s garbage reality TV, and no one needed it combined with a brand who, historically, has produced some of the best prestige television ever. But I have no faith in your leadership to continue with that. And I don’t like your garbage app.
Title: Nobody asked for this

Content: HBO max and max are basically the same thing but when me and my girlfriend would watch movies together it isnt the same. i cannot share play on max. HBO max allowed shareplay and i think it is very stupid that i cannot shareplay no more. and max does not have all of the same movies HBO max did, i dont like it.
Title: what i personally think

Content: They could’ve just changed the graphics & name and it would have been great. But instead they created a new layout that has less navigation options and makes for a crappy user experience.
Title: If it isn’t broke, don’t fix it.

Content: So much low quality reality crap has been added since the Discovery merger, the app itself isn’t very user friendly and it would be nice to be able to rate what you watch.
Title: So much reality TV garbage now…

Content: I normally don’t write reviews but the new update made all of the movie and show covers disappear except for those in the trending lists and continue watching lists, so now i pretty much can’t even use the app please do another update to fix this issue!
Title: New Update Issues

Content: It’s very disappointing that Max removed features from the Ad-free plan like 4K streaming and limited the number of devices you can concurrently stream from while also thanking you for being a loyal customer. That’s not how you treat loyal customers, you GIVE them more features, not take them away.
Title: Removing Features From Loyal Customers

Content: I’ve been an HBO subscriber forever. Decades. No reward for that loyalty, far from it. Now for no reason other than greed they’ve decided to downgrade everyone on the ad free plan, and 4k is no longer available. I guess they want their content to look worse than all the other providers? I hope they reconsider but I have my doubts
Title: Max downgraded me

Content: My goto.  Especially now that CNN is streaming live all day so I can switch and check the news.
Title: MAX is where its at

Content: I love the selection of movies and shows. I really love that I can watch the food network and HGTV as well as great movies and tv shows I can binge watch.
Title: Love it all

Content: Love the documentary section ! With all kinds of films, just what I needed. As well great channels for my niece , regarding her age enough to keep her entertained with her cousins of all ages.  Great selection.
Title: Caught off guard

Content: "Max" is the dumbest name. "HBO" was one of the most trusted brands in media that brought the world GoT, Sopranos, The Wire, etc etc etc, and somehow y'all decided to scrap it for "Max" that sounds like a knockoff porn site. I hate having to click that big dumb button each time.
Title: "Max"

Content: The content is what you’d expect. The user interface is a lot better than when it was closed “HBO Max”. The download system is still pretty bad though.
Title: Good app

Content: The layout and organization of the old app was great but now I can hardly find anything. The new app is so cluttered and unorganized it’s ridiculous. Hate how it keeps showing the same couple of shows constantly and likes to shove all the crappy offerings by Discovery in your face.
Title: A mess

Content: Things like the Regular Show movie and foster home for imaginary friends is gone so pls bring back
Title: Bring back shows pls

Content: I just miss being able to change my font, size and color!! The new captions are not it for me when I know hbo had great features. I hope Max gets those improvements soon.
Title: MAX subtitles and captions

Content: Like the title says. I can’t go between seasons or the app goes to a blank screen. I can’t search because the keyboard doesn’t pop up when I click on search. The app has been very glitchy lately.
Title: Crashes, blank screens, and missing keyboard for searching

Content: It’s a good streaming service but the ads can get annoying when you get into a movie and all the sudden an ad about itch cream is playing.
Title: Ads

Content: I’m not even talking about their content. Content is great but it doesn’t matter when the app crashes every couple of minutes, and if that wasn’t enough whatever you’re watching restarts from the beginning.
Title: Worst streaming app out there

Content: I heard that the new season of total drama island 2023 was on max but when I search for it nothing comes up so what’s the deal with that?
Title: Total drama island

Content: New app is garbage. Freezes frequently, when playing after pause it jumps back minutes or all the way to beginning. It’s 2023 figure it out, one of the most expensive streaming services should have bad interface.
Title: Terrible

Content: I enjoy max with my grand children. .it has something for everybody and right now we’re eating popcorn and watching max of course
Title: We enjoy max

Content: I love watching South Park it’s a very good tv show although I do wish my oc zaiden could still save the fou4 main characters with guns and knife from fan girls I do like Kyle but not to where I make fan art of it!
Title: Video to watch

Content: My toddler wants to watch Sesame Street immediately and doesn’t understand why it takes daddy 10 minutes to put it on when I have to re-authenticate for the third time in a week.  With HBO Max I rarely, if ever, needed to sign in again.  With Max, it feels like the login expires after 3 days.  What gives?
Title: Allow for longer authentication periods

Content: “Let’s change the color, shorten it to just one name, and flooded our ‘new’ app’s reviews with botted 5 star ratings. See we don’t have to actually make a decent streaming app! We just have to put a new coat of paint on it. Our catalogue that we license out to other streaming services for quick cash will carry us through this new ~branding~ phase.”
Title: Boomer company

Content: Got an email with all the new  shows and movies just out on max But can’t find them on the site as I forgot the names
Title: Trouble finding new shows & movies

Content: Every time I try to scroll down to browse for available shows or movies it always goes back to the top of the screen within seconds. I’ve been trying to find kids shows many times for later viewing and it’s very annoying. Please fix.
Title: Not working on Apple TV

Content: “This application requires iOS 14.0 or later.” The previous HBO Max app was working just fine but will no longer load on older Apple devices. I guess HBO is tired of being a premium service. I’ll never know if they release a compatible version because I’ll be busy watching other apps that still work.
Title: Watch you later, HBO

Content: Rewatching some of my old Cartoon Network shows from Middle School. Good times.
Title: Great shows from back in the old Cartoon Network days!

Content: The app on my smart tv will constantly glitch and then the sound will not match the video. The only way to fix is to back out of the episode or movie and then start it back. Also, if I try to go back on video it will not let me. App needs some work to fix these issues…
Title: Bugs Need Fixed

Content: This app is so broken. The old hbo max was perfect and now it’s ruined with a load of bugs and horrible user interface. So sad
Title: Max

Content: App overall works well, unfortunately has buffering issues when a new Scene begins. I am sure small bugs will be fixed soon being that it’s a new app system.
Title: Buffering issues

Content: HBO has had HBO Now, HBO Go, then HBO Max, and now just Max and they STILL can’t get it right. This app is trash. Not only is the UX garbage and a step backwards but it refuses to Chromecast when every other streaming app is fine with that. Fire your 4th CTO over not getting this right and let’s look forward to the next app release because this should go straight in the garbage.
Title: Garbage, unusable

Content: I rewatch Lota of show and new one but the more I watch them the faster they disappear off my recently watching. Movies I ended have been on there for months. It gets very annoying searching up the show and what episode I was on.
Title: Shows disappear from my recently watching

Content: When they changed from HBO Max to Max it now takes me back from season 3 to season one episode one and I have to try to remember what episode I am on real frustrating
Title: It worked fine before the change

Content: Compared to HBO max the functionality when casting to your chrome cast is very diminished. To pause half the time it’s easier to disconnect then reconnect the cast. Hoping a future update will rectify this issue
Title: Doesn’t work well with chrome cast

Content: It’s very good I like how the new designs are it’s way better than the old app and I say that the Hbo ceos did a wonderful job making this app
Title: Best movie app

Content: Tbh max be skipping like a boot leg when the scene change on a show. But other than that it’s cool. I love all of the Cartoon Network classics. Max also has some good black movies. Max Create more  for-black-by-black- people shows.
Title: The honest review

Content: My iPad isn’t even that old yet somehow I can’t run “MAX” period. It is literally the only unusable app I have ever come across. “HBO Max” was incredible, probably my favorite app, but since they have gone so Max heavy, forcing it on us, I can no longer watch any HBO shows on this iPad because it doesn’t allow you to run the old app either. Unbelievable. 0 stars.
Title: Unusable

Content: This feels more better and more accessible than the older version
Title: A good upgrade

Content: I don’t enjoy watching a movie and having the video quality randomly change. Max is the only streaming service I have this problem with. Instead of rebranding every year, how about making some technical improvements instead?
Title: Max video quality needs improvement

Content: The device I used the most to stream HBOMax now for not work on Max.  It need a higher IOS then my two year old iPad has.  The yearly renewal is next month. I am debating if I need to get a new device or cancel altogether.
Title: No longer available on my iPad

Content: When scrolling through different movies or shows on the Apple TV version, the app keeps bouncing me back to the top of the screen.  Makes it very difficult to browse when every 10 seconds, I get kicked back to the top.  Makes me want to cancel my subscription until they fix it.
Title: Really Buggy!!

Content: Finally HBO Max app was relatively stable and we dice right back into the same buggy issues we had to endure previously.   Full screen is buggy, internet connectivity is buggy, random restarts, generic errors.   For a company that establishes such great creative content for viewers, it’s shocking that they can provide the same standard in their application.
Title: Stupid Move

Content: Easy upgrade from the old app. Much more responsive. Love the added titles. Enjoying the new stuff from Discovery+. Streams seem smoother too!
Title: Smooth & Sweet Upgrade!

Content: HBO Max, HBO Go, now Max… Instead of making me install a new app to view the same content, you should’ve changed the name and logo of the previous HBO Max app. Horrid integration of a “new” rebranded service. Also to be labeled Editor’s Choice on the day of release is a bit ridiculous - especially considering nothing about the app interface is even different. Lame.
Title: My third HBO app..

Content: HBO Max worked perfectly fine being stationed in Europe. But as soon as they randomly switch to this terrible app, I won’t be able to watch my shows until 2024. Watching with a VPN doesn’t help either. It’s bad enough I can hardly watch any streaming service over here, and now I’m unable to view anything. Thanks a lot HBO.
Title: Insanely Ridiculous

Content: When it comes to bringing back some movies that are a little older, thanks for the good choices!
Title: Great choices

Content: This is so much worse than the HBOmax app, and it’s nearly unusable on the Apple TV. No support for Up Next. Custom video player that is just terrible and lacks basic Apple TV functions. All this and I have to pay $50 a year more for a drastically degraded version of what I was paying for before? I’m leaning toward just canceling my subscription.
Title: Such a huge downgrade

Content: Even w/ screen orientation unlocked the app flips back to as if it was locked. It does it randomly and also when I close and reopen the app from my app tabs or whatever they’re called on iPhone.
Title: Screen orientation bug

Content: A whole bunch of good options this app is goated 💯 this app is winning some many good options and Dc comics are better love this dang app we’re married now😂😌
Title: W app

Content: Best streaming service to date ,great shows and movies always,never am I left with nothing to watch
Title: Max

Content: Love this app until recently. When you start a show and if you leave the app and then go back to it, it starts your show all over from the beginning. Not sure what the issue is. But please fix!
Title: Loved until recently

Content: Have an old subscription on tv and a new one on my phone different sign in info how do I do it please
Title: Help

Content: Love the movie and show selection on Max but every time switch screens or reopen the app whatever I’m watching starts from the beginning. Super annoying.
Title: Issues when closing and reopening app

Content: Ever since they changed from HBO to Max, there’s been a lag issue and I’m really tired of it. I thought this was a quality company, and it was, when it was HBO. Now the apparently don’t want to spend the money to be handle all the content efficiently. Sad.
Title: Problem with lag

Content: Great app high quality video. Would recommend to anyone interested in watching some great videos.
Title: Max 💯

Content: One of the best streaming sights but needs shuffle button for shows to watch random episodes
Title: Add shuffle button for each show

Content: I’ve paid for HBO forever it seems, but the content these last four months is a joke!  The Original content is garbage and the movies are tired and old.  Reach out when you decide to provide something of value.
Title: Waste of Money

Content: Please fix this!  If you pause a show or movie and come back to play, it reverts to the beginning, so annoying!
Title: Pause then restart?  🤬

Content: The app itself works fine, but one of the things I liked about HBO Max was that I could watch things with my long distance boyfriend using SharePlay on FaceTime. Please make Max compatible with SharePlay!
Title: SharePlay

Content: This app is way glitchier than the HBO Max app. Every time you pause it goes back to the beginning of the episode or the last place you paused. If you’re streaming from your phone to a device, every time you open the app back up it goes back to the beginning. So annoying
Title: So freaking glitchy

Content: Really ending the best show on the platform Called Winning time on the Lakers Dynasty losing to the Celtics the FIRST time they play?! What about the other 2 times. What kind of ratings are you expecting, if anything it’s HBO’s marketing fault anyone who watch the show got hooked. Didn’t see much advertisement for season 2 tho like season 1.
Title: Why the was the best slow on MAX cancelled??!!!

Content: This is not the HBO MAX for my region, in app store is not available the correct one, I googled it, when I click to download it sends me to app store, but it shows just a blank page, it does not shows the information of the app and to download it, I really like to know what to do because I am paying and I don’t want to cancel
Title: App hbo max not for my region

Content: One of the worst apps among streaming services. I cant believe I cant travel outside the US a single time without my entire downloaded content disappearing. This happened with the old HBO app and is happening now. I thought they would fix this with the new app….
Title: Not friendly

Content: Can’t open any show with out the whole app  freezing and black screening. It deleted all of my downloads also so I’m unable to Watch anything. I love this app please fix this.
Title: Freezing with new update.

Content: When casting to a Sony Bravia, it immediately raises the volume on the tv to 100. This is the only app that does it. Every other streaming app works perfectly from iPhone to tv and doesn’t touch the tv volume. Please fix this.
Title: Has major volume bugs in new version.

Content: Subtitles and audio language setting functions are unusable. Audio will randomly switch to a different language for no reason and cannot change back. Subtitles only reflect certain languages even though the website provides otherwise.
Title: Awful

Content: Why is it so difficult to produce a streaming app with a functional iser friendly interface? Especially at this point in the game. Seriously it’s 2023 folks, maybe have a look around and see what the competition is up too. There are some fine examples of brilliantly executed, simple navigation that just works.
Title: Why

Content: Whenever I try to go to the page for particular shows, like Banshee, the screen flickers then goes black. I cannot get this to load up no matter how many times I load up. So far, this is the only show it’s happening with but this crap is annoying.  Fix this mess.
Title: Freezing up

Content: I love how you bring back old shows. I could binge watch all day. Would love the soul food season to come back
Title: Great shows

Content: Subscriber Beware!  Never assume that HBO created content will be available on Max. Westworld is unavailable in the app.  Max also doesn’t manage your payments, I was charged through YoutubeTV which I don’t have an active subscription with. But they still have my payment information.   There are no direct ways to Contact Max, instead you will be directed through a complete unhelpful faq page that will not answer your questions or be connected with someone who can help.  When decide to cancel, and you will.  It will be a nightmare to revoke your subscription.
Title: Difficult to Cancel

Content: I spent 2 hrs on the phone with Optimum last night trying to connect. I have HBO Max thru them. The worst part of your app is that there is no ability to connect to customer service and the troubleshooting info is a joke. I asked the optimum guy last night at 11:35(after an hr) if he has to do this with many people. Yes, unfortunately, he said.
Title: Max

Content: I Max is amazing. They have fabulous programming and now we only need one app to look at the billing and problems. Makes my life easier.
Title: MAX

Content: Movie night to the max. Best collection for every age, you can’t beat that. Old movies,New movies, colt classic movies the collection is amazing.
Title: Every mood in one place

Content: It is so good so many shows so many options definitely recommend
Title: The best

Content: Having all the cartoon network episodes really takes me back, i love it.
Title: Cartoon Network

Content: I can’t use this app anywhere it’s frustrating because it’s my favorite streaming app. What’s going on?
Title: Usage

Content: Max has an eclectic selection of movies and shows to make even the choosey person content
Title: Great time for all

Content: Doesn’t have many of the best movies - only one Tom Hanks movie, and very few of the others I like.  Maybe it will get better - just getting started with it.
Title: A Little Light on Good Movies

Content: Max has been great and has a really vast selection of movies and the quality is terrific definitely worth it
Title: Max

Content: I enjoy this app because I get to see very good movies or else I would have to wait till they put them on Netflix or Disney +.
Title: MAX

Content: Wish they had options for the caption text size and color.
Title: Captions

Content: Would be a 5 star rating but you guys took out uploading your own icons 👎👎👎
Title: Bring back uploading your own avatars!!

Content: Max is great so far, but I think it’s annoying that you have to review the moment you open the app, and that should be changed.
Title: Well…

Content: “Next episode” button shows up all the way at the end of an episode. Have to scroll through all the episodes of a season now.

Content: It logs me out every day. Then says constantly gives me errors logging in through my provider. When it does log on it’s frozen on a Home Screen. You can’t search for anything. Once they rebranded the app went trash. Considering canceling it the issue is not fixed. Very disappointed.

Content: This app is so glitchy. Half the time it doesn’t keep your place if you stop an episode or movie mid-stream and the other half of the time it glitches out and just goes to a black screen. Massive downturn changing from the HBO Max app to this app. Complete garbage in comparison

Content: Ever since HBO Max has been updated to Max my devices cannot login to max anymore. Tried all the options of resetting passwords and never receiving an email and just sends me to a page that’s even more unhelpful. Redownloaded the app and tried it on other devices. Never received max from any provider. It’s been wasting my time nonstop
Title: Max update

Content: Just like the last two apps you’ve created and had to erase from existence to save face, this one is also garbage. The mere idea that you could just erase all the negative feedback about your garbage tech by doing a little rebrand and then rereleasing the same dysfunctional joke back onto the public claiming it works makes you absolute thieves.
Title: TRASH ONCE AGAIN!!

Content: My account since the rebranding will not track which episode I am currently on in a given show and season. If I restart an episode it will not start at the beginning, it starts at the end forcing me to manually rewind. Until this basic functionality is remedied I am leaving my review at one star.
Title: Rebranding broke a perfectly fine app

Content: So far it’s ok, but there have been too many times  it seems like it is loading in a middle of a season
Title: Review on MAX

Content: I like the upgrade. I would only ask for a more in depth categorization and actor search queue.
Title: New interface

Content: Keeps saying email and password aren’t right when I know they are cause I successfully logged in on another device…  Update: I went to the site they directed me to and there’s no helpful information there on why my login worked on my TV and iPad but still isn’t working on my phone…. Super frustrating.
Title: Can’t login

Content: Not user friendly at all. Please switch back to the “just added” and “last chance” menus. Now there are 4 different spots to check them and it all shows different things.
Title: Terrible since the change to max

Content: Whenever I’m trying to start where I left off in a show I now have to search the show and like fast forward where I was at before and in “continue watching” they don’t update it to be accurate anymore
Title: Impossible to find where you left off in shows in the same ease as HBO Max

Content: When it was HBO Max there was a shuffle button for most shows so the show never stopped playing unless you told it to. Can we bring that back
Title: BRING BACK THE SHUFFLE BUTTON

Content: I like the additional content beyond HBO, but the app is finicky and not easy to use. Once they go through a couple updates, change the structure, and intuitiveness hopefully it will get better.

Content: I was happy until I could not customize the  profile picture to something from my camera roll. That's it tho. This is a good app
Title: Bring back the HBO

Content: Why cant i skip 10 seconds faster
Title: Slow

Content: They updated the app after all of the initial complaints, and yet full-screen iPad Pro playback is still a disaster. Who wants to see the time, battery, and status bar? It worked fine before creating an unneeded new app. They simply needed to rename the existing app, but instead they created a new dysfunctional one.
Title: Full-screen fail

Content: I hate now that you can’t continue watching a program.  When I stop watching a series and stop and the next day want to continue it the next day it goes back to season 1 episode 1.  So please bring back continue watching.

Content: The screen orientation has been flipping or rotating while I watch on my phone. My phone does not have orientation locked and I keep it on a stand while I watch. No reason for it to randomly go upside down.
Title: Orientation not working

Content: I don’t understand why the need to make an entire new app, because HBO MAX was fine and worked as intended. The UI on MAX is unappealing, not user friendly, and convoluted. It needs to be cleaned up, or at least mimic HBO MAX so it’s a familiar layout for users who already have been a subscriber.
Title: The user interface is dreadful

Content: Header (time, battery etc) and iPad footer bar never disappear. Resuming from the TV App starts the show earlier than I left off. Lost my user profile, watch list, watched episodes. Guess they couldn’t figure out how to migrate their user base?  Maybe hitting space bar on my iPad’s keyboard could start and stop the show?   Hot garbage that I’ll be canceling.

Content: I like how you can actually watch all new movies from DC and some things I did not get to see in the HBO Max
Title: The best app ever since the re-brand

Content: Closed captions, fast forward, and rewind are all missing when using chromecast. The pause button is there but doesn’t work. This makes the app almost unusable for me as someone who’s hard of hearing. Hoping for fixes as these weren’t issues with hbo max.
Title: Spotty with chromecast

Content: People love to complain when things aren’t perfect or when something changes.  It’s a streaming platform, just like all platforms it’s not great, but it’s not terrible.

HBO was where it was, this is awful. Hate everything about it. It used to feel unique and special, now it feels bland and generic. I hope many people get in trouble.

Content: Title says it all. What an absolute waste of time. I hope that the idiot executive who asked for this  complete rebranding and new app (for no reason) understands how much of a waste of time and resources this exercise was. Unless the intention was to enrage customers (and waste millions), if that’s the case they should know they did an awesome job.

The login looks exactly like discovery plus(which looks like it came from 2012), they removed our custom profile pictures, and nothing even really changed in the where you watch the movies. Why waste money, time, and effort just to lose features and downgrade?

Content: I don’t want to see ads when I start something. I don’t want to see ads anywhere. I don’t pay the basic. I pay premium. Eff out of here with garbage irrelevant ads that I don’t care for. Yea right this is why I DOWNLOADED before I left home

Will be our last month paying for HBO or whatever it is called now.

The latest version of iOS for iPad and for the Max app are installed.  The online Max help is not helpful for this situation.

Content: HBO has a nice selection and I enjoy watching what they offer.. when the app works. I have to regularly uninstall and reinstall the app because it gets stuck on audio description mode for visually impaired viewers.   I tried everything, I even logged in on a laptop to check settings on my account. On my laptop it’s fine, on my iPhone it’s fine, when I Chromecast to a tv I get audio description EVERY time.   Fix the app or I’m canceling subscription. I don’t need someone describing the wb logo and the dimly lit street sign every time I want to watch Harry Potter.

Content: Users signed into this app can change their password directly in the app with no form of 2 factor authentication, no validation email, nothing. I really cannot overstate how dangerous this is. There is literally no reason for a modern app not to have SOME form of protection against this, it is so easy to incorporate. This is pure laziness and negligence on Max's end.
Title: Security Risk

Content: i don’t really have anything bad to say about the app but i had something odd happen after i downloaded the app. i have never pre-ordered an app so this was the first time i ever did it. when the app became available at midnight on tuesday it was working fine but i noticed that the concert ticket app, axs was on my home screen beside it. i’m pretty sure i had axs on my phone months ago but deleted it pretty soon after so i was confused as to how it magically appeared on my phone again.  i even deleted max and reinstalled it and lo and behold axs came back with it & im confused because i have never had this happen when downloading any other apps on my phone.

Content: Well… HBO Max used to so full of potential and it used to be fine by its own, until Zaslav came in and messed it all up.  Some shows got removed because of him. And the tax write-offs, and the layoffs on the company, and everything because of him.  So, if you think about it, it’s all Zaslav’s fault in the first place for making all this happen.  Plus, that big name change, though. I mean, think about the kids (and maybe some people) who got bullied all because of it, and because their names were Max.

Content: You guys said this was going to be an update. I don’t care about what this app possibly has to offer, you gave an objectively worse app and didn’t even bother to update the original, instead updating it to give a link to this app. AT&T should’ve never acquired WB
Title: So…not an update?

Content: I did not like how this app was launched at all. I couldn’t not share play at all or anything. Everything seemed very unauthentic. And very unappealing at first didn’t seem useful as how the old HBO max app was . I’m just very disappointed of how this app was given to us all HBO max watchers

Content: I enjoy the new Max for all the science and nature documentaries. I’m eager to explore what else max has on their line up.

Too update I spoke to support 3 times and 4 different people to which I was told and I quote Tough enjoy our products I can’t duh! If I could give 0 stars I would!!!!!! I demanded a refunded for the past month or no charge this month! Rudest customer Support I’ve dealt with!!!!!!!

Content: No one asked for this. Setting aside the moronic idea of dropping one of the most iconic brands in TV, why do I have to download a new app? Also a lot of random, miscellaneous bugs. Content: Wish i could scroll through titles as i write this then i could list the shows that have saved my life, quality and quantity, and been fun all the while. However this review window just popped up so doing what i can in the moment.  They used to call TV the “Boob Tube” while overlooking its impact on a young priviledged generations’ witnessing war atrocities and asking questions and taking action as a result as well as shows that were cathartic for the social changes that without art to help integrate would have been even more overwhelming than they already were.  And I think the plethora and quality of shows these days in general is astounding and likely taken for granted as we humans tend to do; there are teams of writers these day more so than in the past and perhaps larger teams, more diversity and so much more integrated with knowledge in general such as psychology and politics and ecology etc.  “My List” feature nice as is option to download.  I haven’t used Netflix in a long time so can’t review a comparison and Showtime…well again I don’t recall programs there vs here off the top of my head.  Too bad all these providers can’t share content more readily as while it is great to escape and even conversely or concurrently get deeper into life and relationships etc. through art that also means my brain is not paying so much attention to the service through which i am watching it so no details stored in my old brain to list here.  Also it is somewhat socially separating to have access only to shows in one streaming service vs another.  Another improvement would be to have more social access, discussions about the movies and potentially even watch parties where we all watch one at the same time and discuss afterwards.
Title: Therapeutic and far more sane often than the so called real-world

Content: I use an Apple TV to watch Max, and the first issue I noticed with the new Max app (after changing from HBO Max) is that the player has been completely changed. Quick rewind/fast forward has been removed. With the old HBO Max app, I could simply click the left/right sides of the remote during playback to quickly move backward or forward. Now with the new Max app, I can only do quick rewinds/forwards by pausing first. This issue is compounded by the fact that resuming playback after pausing always jumps the video forward by a few seconds, so I can never actually resume the video exactly where I left off, and I can never skip to exactly where intended. The main reason I usually like to do a quick rewind is to listen again to something I missed, but when the video jumps forward upon resuming playback, I still end up missing what I'm trying to listen to, which is needlessly frustrating. The issue with the video jumping too far forward also happens when skipping intros. Whenever I hit the option to skip an intro or an ad, the beginning of the episode is cut off as it skips forward too far. This becomes very obvious with fast paced shows that have dialogue the moment the episode starts, as I usually end up missing the first half of a sentence of dialogue after skipping an intro. So then I end up pausing, doing a quick rewind, and then being forced to watch part of the ad and/or intro just so I can actually see the beginning of an episode. The player is just so much clunkier than it needs to be now, especially considering the player was perfect the way it was in the original HBO Max app. Developers, if you're reading this, please consider fixing this in a future update by reverting to the original player from the HBO Max app.
Title: Please bring back the original player controls

Content: Who is the marketing genius? That thought people weren’t gonna confuse this with Cinemax? The  channel that HBO has been in competition with since premium cable was invented. I hate the blue I loved the purple I understand whoever made the choice to change it to blue doesn’t like purple and that’s why they did it. They did not think of your consumer base when they did that. if someone is not being fired over this change, they really need to be but I’m sure they’re getting fat raises and bonuses because of it because in house you’re thinking this was a good launch. there was zero reason to make people download another app. My TV could not figure out how to do it. I downloaded the app about six times before it actually took and that’s not an old TV that’s a new TV so it shouldn’t of had any trouble and after I download it, it would get confused on which apt actually open, even when I would click the Max app, which makes no sense since they’re supposedly two different apps.   Add to the fact that nothing is sorted the same way either so I can’t find anything now which is also irritating. Unless it was actually in my list I got no idea how you guys are sorting things. On HBO max everything was broken down really nicely into different categories and now it’s just all lumped together and I hate that. Again unless you guys have merged with Cinemax which I couldn’t find any news on there was zero reason not to just call this HBO. Drop everything else, drop the go, drop the now, drop the whatever and just call it HBO. Why is that so difficult we don’t need plus we don’t need add we don’t need any of that discovery or whatever just call it HBO and let that be the end of it even if you’ve merged with whatever but since you are not merging with Cinemax, there was no reason to call it Max.  With all that said, if you need a new person to take over whomever made this decision I am your girl. I got qualifications and got degrees with over 30 years work experience. I got whatever you need and you can pay me 75% whatever you paid the person that made the decision to call this Max and I’ll be fine with it. I don’t even need a bonus but I’ll take it and I guarantee you I can make it a better app than anybody who decided to call this Max and confuse people thinking it’s Cinemax.
Title: Oh this isn’t Cinemax aka Skinemax?

Content: You know the radio hasn’t heard a not for miles right.   The hosts are at home asleep   But with your numb clamming fingers stuck to that steering wheel, you don’t care.  You’re too focused on getting out.   It's hard to believe it’s been 3 hours since you’ve seen them  You miss them, but that doesn’t seem to bother you  All that matters is getting there, seeing them.   Then maybe you’ll feel it again  A click, a sound on the radio, a sign of life.   You recognize the song but can’t remember the words.   A melody, flows in the shape of sadness, and the feeling of cold.   It reminds you of something  A thought that cost you a freethought for the rest of your life.  You waited for this moment  It came, and it went, and you feel exactly the same way you’ve felt for 3 days  And now you’re left with my thoughts again.   The memory doesn’t fade  You can feel their skin  It was awfully dark to tell, wasn’t it  That’s the last time you felt it.  What a way to start your adult life.  Lose at your own hands is a uniquely terrible thing.  But when it’s past, it’s past   You have to move on.   After all its been 3 weeks and you’re still gripping that steering wheel   Nomatter how numb your fingers are.  When they left, you felt nothing.  And when they came back, you felt worse.  That’s why you did it  You waited for this  You weren’t sure it was the right time, but.  You had to do it.  You loved her  I have nothing to do with this  I have nothing in common with you, nor do I wish to.   I am merely the messenger of your intrusive thoughts.  The executioner of rash decisions  Thats me, in your head  I offer to all, but you accepted.  You acted on it.  And you don't know when you’ll be able to see it.  3 months, wanting a way out of the situation  Out of your mind   That’s why you took a drive.   Static, because you’ve been driving for 3 years now,  And your glassy eyes can’t see your knuckles have gone white  And your ringing ears can’t hear me anymore.   The radio has been static for a while now, but  You’re still humming that tune you heard 3 days ago  They were there with you  You’re dry lips crack and bleed when you smile.  You can feel them now  Sweet static clawing at your cheeks  But your dry eyes, and your cracked lips can barely feel the tears falling  A sunrise on a new day, a cloud atop a hill  You can see it   In your rear view mirror  A mirage of a better decision  Would you believe it if you saw it?  Would you want to?  You know what you did.  But refuse to accept it  A world that gave them to you  And took them away  It doesn’t matter   They will move on.  They will forgive you   But you took the air for them to say that   Great things come for those who wait  For the static, the fog, the ringing to stop  After all without the rain, the flowers still come  You’re 3 minutes away now   And you can finally open your eyes  But adventures never really end do they?  Someone has to carry on the story.

Content: I recently had the pleasure of exploring the streaming service Max, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in many ways. With its vast library of movies and TV shows, Max truly offers a delightful entertainment experience. The user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate, allowing me to effortlessly discover new content and enjoy my favorite shows.  One aspect that particularly impressed me was the quality of the streaming. The video and audio were both crystal clear, ensuring an immersive viewing experience. Furthermore, Max's recommendation algorithm seemed to understand my preferences well, suggesting a variety of titles that matched my interests perfectly.  Additionally, Max offers a great selection of original content. From gripping dramas to hilarious comedies, there's something for everyone. I found myself binge-watching several of their original series, thoroughly enjoying the captivating storytelling and brilliant performances.  While the recent name change to Max may have caught some users off guard, I believe it is a testament to the company's commitment to rebranding and adapting to the evolving market. After all, a name doesn't define the quality of the service it represents. Max remains a top-notch streaming platform, and I look forward to continued enjoyment of its exceptional content.  Mean Review: Let me start by saying that the recent name change to Max for this streaming service was absolutely dumb. Seriously, who came up with that? It's like they just picked a random three-letter word out of a hat and decided to roll with it. It's neither catchy nor memorable, and it certainly doesn't reflect the excitement and innovation one would expect from a streaming platform.  But let's move past the name and focus on the service itself. Frankly, I found Max to be rather underwhelming. The library of content is limited compared to other streaming platforms, and the user interface feels clunky and outdated. It's a struggle to find anything worth watching, and the recommendation algorithm seems to be completely off the mark.  Even worse, the streaming quality is often subpar, with frequent buffering and poor video resolution. It's frustrating to invest time and money into a service only to have it constantly interrupted by technical issues. It's as if Max doesn't prioritize providing a smooth and seamless viewing experience for its users.  To add insult to injury, the original content on Max is mostly lackluster. The shows and movies I encountered were uninteresting and failed to captivate my attention. It's a shame because other streaming platforms have raised the bar with their compelling originals, but Max seems to fall flat in this regard.  In conclusion, the name change to Max was just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the disappointments I experienced with this streaming service. With its limited content, poor user interface, and lackluster original productions, Max leaves much to be desired. Save your money and look elsewhere for a more satisfying streaming experience.

Content: I pay for a service and I gotta download a whole new app?? And I only use hbo max for hbo max exclusives.

If you're on the lookout for a streaming app that delivers an unparalleled entertainment experience, look no further than Max, the sensational HBO app. Max has completely revolutionized the way we enjoy movies and shows, offering an outstanding range of content combined with a user-friendly interface that will leave you in awe.  From the moment you open the app, Max grabs your attention with its sleek design and intuitive layout. Browsing through the extensive library of movies and shows is an absolute pleasure, thanks to its well-organized categories and powerful search functionality. Whether you're in the mood for an action-packed thriller, a heartwarming drama, a thought-provoking documentary, or anything in between, Max has you covered with its diverse and captivating selection.  What truly sets Max apart is its unrivaled collection of HBO originals and exclusive content. The app seamlessly delivers the latest releases from HBO, providing subscribers with access to critically acclaimed series like "Game of Thrones," "Chernobyl," "Westworld," and "Succession." These shows have redefined television and become cultural phenomena, and Max grants you unlimited access to binge-watch them to your heart's content.  But Max doesn't stop there. The app also offers a treasure trove of movies from various genres, ensuring there's something for everyone. From timeless classics to the latest blockbusters, you can dive into a world of cinematic wonders. With Max, you're not just subscribing to a streaming service; you're gaining entry to a boundless universe of storytelling that will captivate and enthrall you.  The streaming quality on Max is exceptional, delivering stunning visuals and crisp audio that enhances your viewing experience. Whether you're streaming on your TV, laptop, or mobile device, Max optimizes the content for each platform, ensuring that you're immersed in every frame. The app also provides the option to download movies and episodes for offline viewing, perfect for those long flights or when you're on the go.  One of Max's standout features is its personalized recommendations. Through its intelligent algorithms, the app learns your viewing preferences and suggests movies and shows tailored to your tastes. This thoughtful curation allows you to discover hidden gems and explore new genres, making every session on Max a delightful journey of exploration.  In addition to its outstanding content and user-friendly interface, Max offers exceptional customer service and support. The app is regularly updated with new features and improvements, and any technical issues are promptly addressed, ensuring a seamless and hassle-free streaming experience.  Max's subscription plans are competitively priced, offering excellent value for the sheer quantity and quality of content available. With a range of options to choose from, including family plans, Max accommodates different viewing needs and budgets, making it accessible to a wide audience.

Content: The library of content is wide and generally interesting, although it seems to have overloaded on chintzy reality trash lately, at the expense of HBO’s library and other top-tier titles. What is especially concerning is that the really good drama and comedy series are fewer and further between in recent years. Apple TV+ has taken the mantle for ‘premium TV where every show is worth a watch’ away from HBO, which seems to be increasingly inert.  The video player is fine, but there’s nothing in the non-native interface that justifies itself over the native player. Subtitles sometimes get activated without consent, especially when a video gets windowboxed to suggest a next title, but one returns to the current video for watching the end credits. Circular scrubbing with the Apple TV remote is missing. I also can’t tap (not click) the remote to dismiss the video player controls or see the current end-time of the video. All of these are annoying. Very annoying. Netflix uses the native player and it’s great. This is worse. I don’t understand why HBO/Max doesn’t use the native player, although I’m sure some middle manager is enjoying a bonus somehow.  Being able to skip pre-roll content ads as a no-ads customer is a table stakes feature at this point and one of the things I appreciate when compared to Paramount+, which forces viewing of such ads even for premium/“no ads” subscribers. Don’t ever change that.  If I could change three things, one would be to revert to the native video player as explained above. Second would be to lose the overlay showing rating/content info at the beginning of any title for far too long as playback starts. Either return to an info card as one might see on an HBO broadcast in the past 35+ years, or find some other way to not have it in the way of whatever show or movie has already started.  Last would be to re-enable the download/use of the iPad app for Mac users (or make a native Mac app). While streaming in the browser is ‘fine’, not being able to download titles for offline viewing is seriously shortsighted. Prime Video has an app for Mac users, and downloads are available. Apple TV+ (and any subscriptions via the TV app) does too. The old HBO Max app was enabled and worked great on my Macs. My M2 MacBook Air is my best portable screen and I dislike the notion of ‘taking a iPad too’ just to have this flexibility. I see no reason not to opt-in to Mac use of the app that isn’t traceable to a paranoid, distrustful stance towards paying customers.  It’s an above average service, a okay app with seemingly easily-fixable shortcomings, and there’s nothing I need to go back and forth with customer support about. Fix the deficiencies and this becomes an unqualified top-tier 5-star option.

Content: Go to a site like Metacritic and search on HBO and Max. Unless you want a few reality shows from the Discovery side, there is basically nothing being offered from HBO or Max over the next 6 months. What a drop from the stellar premiere service of old. After selling content to other services, the new CEO wants to make money by only producing cheap content. Sure there are still some old hits hanging out for those who have never seen them, and some decent series were wrapped up, but for the monthly price Max is asking there are MUCh better options. Apple TV has been killing it with new content and Netflix has something for everyone. Even Peacock and Paramount have managed to offer some interesting stuff. Max is not a must have anymore. Get it for a month or two and then move on. It's time to send a message to services who intentionally holdback on new content and ask equivalent payment to those who continue to add new programming to theirs. And to be clear, this is not because of the writers strike which will ultimately affect all services. This was planned and advertised well in advance of that. I have no problem paying a service like Netflix who offers a variety of content even if not all of it appeals to me. Vote with your pocketbooks people or they will continue to take advantage of a brand name that they no longer support or honor. ================================================== UPDATE😃: A feature I did not find until today ups this App's functionality and I wish all other Apps would do this. No matter where you are in the App, by holding down the Select button on a show/movie you would like put in your List, it will automatically put it there. You can also delete in the same manner. Similarly you can also delete content in your Continue Watching area by holding down the Select button. I have tested this on Apple TV plus a Fire Cube and both work although on Fire Cube you must hold down the Select button longer plus to remove you hold down longer than get asked if you want to delete. I can't give this App any more stars until content is more defined in the GUI interface but the above usability is a stellar improvement. ******************************************************************** Seldom does a new app come out without glaring bugs. So far this one seems to be the exception. Voice search on Apple TV and control over Autoplay are welcome features. However, with the addition of Discovery Plus content the app has become overwhelming in size. The category 'Brand Spotlight' is buried several rows down, as other Apps have done, where placing it on the top would be more efficient and practical. The massive amount of categories and large picture icons is time consuming to navigate and only serves to keep eyes in the app rather than help direct consumers to content they would prefer. Unfortunately, MAX has not broken away from all the other apps that have crowded screens that need to be endlessly scrolled to find something to watch. The categories 'For You' and ‘Featured' are more about them trying to steer you to programming they want you to watch. Taking away sidebars in the Home Screen that helped you quickly narrow your search was a huge mistake. The top row of Home, Series, Movies, HBO, New & Notable is so generic that, with the amount of content MAX now has, it just opens up a maze that is cavernous. At some point content providers will have to come to the realization that customers respond better to simplicity than complexity. At first the 'All you can eat' buffet of programming does dazzle consumers but eventually that wears off and they become weary of the struggle to find a good content fit.

Content: HBOmax had a user friendly interface that compiled all the shows into categories that made them easy to find and gave good recommendations based on the content you were in. Now max does this worthless amalgamation of all of its content so you NEVER MISS A SHOW OR MOVIE. It’s irritating and it makes me want to leave the app more than watch a show. Before I could go to the sub categories and find exactly what I was looking for, or find new content that I wasn’t even aware of prior to starting up the app and looking at the home page. Now I’m bombarded with endless shows and movies that I have zero intention of watching and when I do find something that interests me even remotely the lack of any follow up material is beyond lack luster. Where you expecting content related to you current watch? Not here at MAX, we just shove all of our high budget shows and movies right back into your face! I literally watched the newest Shazam and when the movie finished I was hoping to continue on the DC train and instead I got; some terrible show that doesn’t interest me, the Meg, a documentary, and another show. Thanks max.  Adult Swims hub was great for watching a lot of shows I grew up on or just enjoy and instead that’s gone. Have to search for my shows like truffle pig hoping just to find one. Before I’d watch multiple shows because they were all conveniently placed for that specific reason and now I forget half of what I’m looking for because of the constant need for max to validate it’s terrible box office performances.  Just fix this already.

Content: I have been paying for the ad free option of HBO Max for several years now, essentially since the app launched. I’ve used it nearly every day since then. It’s always been my number one streaming service. Now I’m seriously considering cancelling all together. I’ve just taken a look at this new app and I’m really shocked. This is such a downgrade in quality. To the point that I feel like paying for it is a waste of my money. When Max was announced I assumed it would just mean a rebranding of the app I already used. Just a new name and maybe some more hubs added for additional content. I don’t understand the thought process behind creating a whole new app when the previous one was fine.   What irks me the most is the design and confusing layout. One of the main reasons I stopped using Netflix was due to their terrible layout. Even though Netflix has a lot of content I find it hard to ever find anything to watch because navigating their selection is so difficult. The navigation on HBO max was always LEAPS ahead of any other service. I found navigating it very easy to do. However all of the features that I enjoyed on the previous app are just gone now. And Max looks a lot like Netflix now. I really don’t now how I’m going to use this. Unless there is a massive overhaul in design change and navigation soon, I will cancel my subscription. I’d rather risk a virus and pirate the films and tv I want to watch than pay for a service that I won’t and can’t use. Really really disappointed today.
Title: Considering cancelling

Content: I recently subscribed to the "Max" streaming service, and I must say, it has been a pleasant surprise. While it may not be perfect, Max offers a solid streaming experience that is worth considering for any avid movie and TV show enthusiast.  One of the standout features of Max is its extensive library of content. With a vast collection of movies and TV shows from various genres, there is something for everyone. Whether you're into action, romance, comedy, or documentaries, Max has you covered. The platform also boasts a good mix of both popular and lesser-known titles, allowing users to discover hidden gems they might have otherwise missed.  The user interface of Max is clean, intuitive, and easy to navigate. Browsing through the library is a breeze, thanks to well-organized categories and a robust search function. The platform also provides personalized recommendations based on your viewing history, which helps in discovering new content tailored to your preferences.  One aspect that sets Max apart from other streaming services is its emphasis on curated collections and exclusive content. The "Max Originals" section offers a range of high-quality, original productions that are both entertaining and thought-provoking. These exclusive shows and movies add value to the service and make it stand out from the competition.  Another notable feature of Max is its streaming quality. The service offers a reliable and stable streaming experience, with minimal buffering, high-definition, and 4K playback. The video and audio quality are impressive, ensuring an immersive viewing experience.  However, there are a few areas where Max could improve. While the library is extensive, there are still some notable titles missing, which can be disappointing for those looking for specific content. Additionally, the availability of subtitles and language options could be expanded to cater to a more diverse audience.  Overall, Max is a solid streaming service that offers a wide range of content, a user-friendly interface, and excellent streaming quality. With its curated collections and exclusive originals, it manages to stand out in a crowded market. While there is room for improvement, Max is definitely worth considering for anyone seeking a diverse and enjoyable streaming experience.
Title: A Solid Streaming Experience with Max

Content: It’s been a few weeks into my subscription , at this point I refuse to change subscriptions to another service because I do catch random programming I enjoy …but I got the low tier with commercials , I don’t mind the commercials but the app will cast and play movies at full volume and in Spanish or worse yet Descriptive Audio Spanish , so it’s like I just stole from a bodega and the owner is yelling at me when I try to watch a movie at first …I can fiddle with the settings some to get around the oddity , but the setting to turn the descriptive audio off is removed from the UI …which is also part of the glitch or problem . Whatever it is , it’s almost comedically engineered to frustrate . Customer service is non existent . I’d been contacted once ..my first contact I was given the equivalent of a screen shot from a trouble shooting faq they’d developed . So they did not read my email . The second time they reached out was a customer service form they sent me …because apparently reading my complaint on the app on the App Store or reading my email prior wasn’t possible . It’s annoying and utterly the reason I’ll end my subscription . I’d requested a refund and that’s just not a thing with them . Considering I believe the glitch to be by design . I mean come on , the button to set the language and descriptive audio back was removed , I think the design maybe intentional somewhere …it’s seems logical because of the parallel of how it’s made to give no solution besides playing with the connections and different app and tv combos . Not sure , I’m convinced that a lot of the tech companies mess with each others business . Either way makes the app the worst and I’d stay away personally , if it works for you , then the programming isn’t half bad . Best of luck

Content: HBO Max changing to MAX seems like another pointless rebranding.   Sure, if you look up the differences between the two, I’m sure the list would be fairly long, but there are still the same issues HBO Max had.   The only noticeable thing, and this could change, is the app lags less when it launches. While the design was slightly changed, there still isn’t a way to clear a show or movie you started and don’t intend to finish.   There are still issues where an episode that was watched previously, starts again at the end, when “next episode” was clicked. Then you have to navigate back to that episode’s home screen, (which is different from the show’s Home Screen, which is different from the regular Home Screen) and hit the “restart episode” button.   When you click on an episode, it immediately plays, rather than showing the episode’s Home Screen, where you can continue where you left off, or restart the show/movie. So there’s a lot of clicking and then backing up, just to do one thing.   Plus the new “shows like this” button, always gets it the way when trying to navigate to a specific season. They put that in a bad place. Selecting a season should be easier than choosing a different show entirely.  The functionality and navigation is still quite flawed. It looks a little better, but while appearance is nice, I think the priority should have been fixing the navigation issues.   So while I like the app’s show and movie selection, the lack of ease with navigating the app leave a lot to be desired.   I’d rather be able to use it easier, than have it only look slightly better than it did.
Title: Unnecessary update that leaves flaws intact

Content: As an avid HBO Max user, I was intrigued when I heard about the new Max app. Having used it for a while now, I have mixed feelings about it. Let me share my thoughts on the app from a first-person perspective.  One thing that caught my attention right away is the improved loading speed. The new Max app definitely delivers on that front. It's refreshing to see how quickly the content loads, allowing me to dive into my favorite shows and movies without any delay. Kudos to the developers for this improvement.  However, there are a few aspects of the app that left me slightly disappointed. One of the features I enjoyed in the previous HBO Max interface was the easy access to genres through the sidebar. It made it convenient for me to explore different categories and discover new content. Unfortunately, the Max app makes this process more cumbersome, requiring excessive swiping and searching to find a specific company or genre. This change felt like a step backward in terms of user-friendliness.  Another drawback I noticed is the absence of a feature to delete a family profile. This omission puzzled me, as it seems like a basic functionality that should be present in a streaming app. It can be frustrating not being able to manage profiles effectively, especially in a family setting.  Despite these downsides, the Max app still retains the overall look and feel of HBO Max, which is reassuring. The familiar interface and content library provide a sense of continuity. However, when considering the drawbacks and inconveniences I mentioned earlier, I don't find the new app compelling enough to warrant uninstalling the old one and installing the updated version.  In conclusion, my experience with the new Max app has been a mixed bag. While the faster loading speed is a definite plus, the hassle of finding specific companies or genres and the absence of a profile deletion feature are notable downsides. If you're an HBO Max user, I'd suggest giving the new app a try, but unless these issues are addressed, it may not be worth the trouble of switching from the previous version.
Title: A mixed bag

Content: First off, the whole thing feels a little more stable which is nice, so GOOD work there.  Simply a better set of options for organizing and viewing your own list would be welcomed.  What is NOT great is that the point in time that you are at in a particular video doesn’t show. Other streaming apps either show it to left of the progress bar or on the actual point at which you are. It would be a much nicer experience.  Another gripe about the progress/time scrub bar is that the arrow forward/back buttons on remotes no longer nudge forward or backward in 10 second increments. Instead it engages fast forward at a speed that is way too fast to quickly stop. It is very frustrating, and brings me to my final issue…  The fast forward/rewind speeds of the actual forward/backward buttons need be addressed in that there needs to be a much slower first-press speed, and a much faster last press speed; I mean slow-mo to fast enough to get to the midway point of a 3 hr movie within a few seconds and completely fast forward through the entire thing in under 10 seconds. It would be extremely welcome for us.  Lastly, as a lover of all things Discovery (especially ID), BRAVO on the new integration. It is a big task and I’m sure will only improve with time. We absolutely love all of the options available. Now just give a new show or movie a chance to gel before unceremoniously ripping it from the service - in some cases with forever cliffhangers - and you are the best thing available to consumers by a mile! Content: The message was that the hbo max app was going to  automatically become the max app. So far I have had to download a new app and delete the old one on my iPhone and Samsung tv. Thankfully my login still worked, although I guess they wouldn’t delete my payment info because that’s what they really want.   I really liked the set up to HBO Max, specifically the list based off studio or whatever they titled the list of DC universe, HBO originals, Cartoon Network, Studio Ghibli and the other ones, I also loved the list of genres those lists allowed me to say I want something I haven’t seen before that is like this other movie or show I watch.   Max only has 3 menu options; Home, Search and My Stuff which makes it a lot harder to browse or find something if you don’t know the name of it.   I was excited for Discovery + to become part of HBO Max because there were documentaries I wanted to see on there but don’t remember the names and it’s hard to find them seeing as there is no Discovery list. All the emails I received said that Discovery + was becoming part of HBO Max and it was being called Max and you wouldn’t loose anything. Well I lost the browsing ease I had before.   All they had to do was add what was available on Discovery + to HBO Max and change the name to Max and yet they went with the deactivate the old apps and delete the entire menu that organized things so nicely and made it easier to find something new to watch in the same style as what you enjoyed before. I don’t like the “you might also enjoy list, because it not accurate and it’s marketing off what they can make money off of. I personally hate the show Rick and Morty, and yet it shows up on multiple “you might also like” lists for me. How is Rick and Morty in anyway related to live action DC universe works? I think it’s more about the Rick and Morty merchandise they have for sale.   Bring back the menu lists of genres and groupings by studio or channel or universe or however they did it, because that is what I liked the most about HBO Max.
