Content: Interface is terrible on Apple TV.  Rewind and fast forward will bug out and force you to hit the back button to get out of the interface. This then undoes the time change and puts you back where you started.  Sometimes the back buttons does nothing and you have to close the app. Garbage.    Want to rewatch a watched episode?  Find it and hit play. You will see the last 3 seconds of that episodes closing credits just before it skips to the next episode. What? Every streaming app out there would have just restarted this episode from the beginning as expected. Not the new MAX!  Want a description of the episode? No longer available when you highlight a thumbnail. You now have click into a few sub menus to find and read the description. This is also where you need to go to find the now hidden “restart” option for an already watched episode.    Had a few episodes play while you were away or fell asleep? Want to rewatch them? Click on the show conveniently under “Continue Watching” and…. it instantly continues playing where it left off. No interface for the season or show at all. You literally have go to the main screen, “Search”, type in the name of the show, click on the show, select the season, then GUESS which thumbnail you want because the episode descriptions are buried under the “Episode Details” button.  Ugh.   Every other streaming app is more intuitive than this crap. And have been for YEARS. The old HBO Max was fine. This new MAX is complete garbage on the Apple TV.  It’s like the Apple TV app was designed by an intern or diversity hire that has zero to little experience.  Do better, Warner Bros!
Title: Terrible on Apple TV

Title: Review

Content: Truly this is a fall from grace. HBO Max was my favorite steaming service of which I have used. Now I hate it. Ignoring all of the blatant downgrades, and tangibly terrible features, my biggest problem is the download limit.   It is useless and, from what I can tell, serves no purpose other than to force people to buy the more expensive version, which is an even worse deal in my opinion. Essentially you can only download 30 episodes or movies at any given time on the middlemost expensive option. That sounds pretty bad, but considering that most other streaming services allow you to have an unlimited amount, it’s very terrible. Really, 30 items? Reallllly? Think of it, most shows have about 12 episodes per season. You have even download 3 seasons of a single show! And it serves them no purpose other than to make money.   Think of it, why would they not want you to download more shows, instead of an unlimited amount of shows as it used to be on HBO max? It couldn’t be anything to do with data, and it’s not running of a server when I watching it off of what I downloaded on my phone. Money! It always comes back to that. They went form paying whatever it was per month, for an observably great service, to a terrible service, with to option to pay more for a slightly less terrible service, to a service that isn’t even worth considering, considering that 4 extra dollars isn’t worth it.  The UI has also had a considerable downgrade too. I won’t go into much detail in this part, but things being sorted alphabetically, and more stuff like they were very convenient. And that’s the sole purpose of a user interface, is convenience, not to spend minutes looking to find something to watch when it should take seconds at most.   Albeit, I still cannot deny the library. It’s still probably the best. Shows and movies that everyone likes; classics, new movies, shows and more, were, and are still there. But what’s the point if I can hardly download much of them, or it’s tedious just to find them. If you look to TV channels, what do you do? You go to the guide and scroll down the channels. Very simple, but a thousand times more easy then the milquetoast UI of Max now. They tried to copy Netflix, and failed terribly. They have the categories like Netflix, but you can only see two cards instead of many more as it should be. So you have to scroll to the side very slowly, and you can only see two or three of the categories at a time, and that’s just one example. Imagine spending hours using the UI and picking it apart then and all the flaws you could find within it.  Again, this is a call for grace. HBO Max was almost undoubtedly the best. The three main things it had going for it were a good library, a good UI, and generally not being frustrating, with glitches and all that. From what I can tell it has only kept one of those. And that is a loss, considering that some of my favorite shows are on there. Essentially, HBO Max was great, Max is bad, fix it please.

Content: The Max app represents a *horrible* regression from the already supremely crappy HBO Max app. The UI is cluttered; the lack of sufficient margins around buttons makes them look and feel claustrophobic; navigation around the UI doesn’t support the native “leaning” paradigm, so movement from element to element is sudden, jarring, often unexpected and unintended, and can even happen *after* clicking a button to navigate to a submenu or play a video (admittedly, this is a holdover from the HBO Max app); the player itself, which is a custom implementation (alas, an all too common trend), doesn’t even support basic Apple TV functions like using the remote ring as a jog wheel for slow scrubbing; and perhaps the biggest regression—the app no longer integrates with the Up Next list in the Apple TV app. This is almost certainly a cross-platform atrocity that Warner Bros. Discovery is trying to pass off as platform-native app—and it shows. It’s also clearly just an (inferior) re-skinning of the bug-ridden HBO Max app, despite HBO executives’ insistence that the app would be “rewritten from the ground up.” (And to top it all off, once you stream something from within the Max app, Warner Bros. Discovery appears to bar your account from accessing the “classic” HBO Max app, precluding the ability to revert to that slightly less terrible older app—with no advance warning whatsoever.)  And this is all in addition to the continued foolhardy adulteration of HBO’s peerless array of first-class content with lowest-common-denominator tripe from the company’s Discovery and network TV libraries. Warner Bros. Discovery’s behavior betrays a fundamental lack of respect for its viewers and represents a continued squandering of the formerly nonpareil brand equity that HBO had spent nigh fifty years painstakingly accruing. David Zaslav should be ashamed.
Title: Horrible Regression & Continued Erosion of the HBO Brand

Content: Don't really see why we needed to download a new app when they could've just updated the old one and make the changes they needed to do with that like every other streaming platform does?!?  Also really annoyed they are limiting screens to watch at the same time like Netflix is did with how many screens you want to pay for. A lot of people dropped Netflix in favor of MAX, so they continue down the same route of Netflix, they will lose a lot of people eventually as well, especially with the high price we are already paying for HBO.  Issues with new app is annoying. I have Apple TV and the newer model remote, I will be scrolling with the touch pad and after about 10-15 options (or less sometimes) it's takes me back to the very top of the page making me having to go all the way back down to the row where I was searching, thankfully it doesn't start me from the very beginning of that row with having to scroll to where I last was, but having a glitch every time I scroll from side to side is not a fun thing to deal with. I tested it with using the buttons on the remote instead of the touch pad and same thing! So I know it's not an apple thing and an app thing!  My advice to MAX, don't go the Netflix route and if it's not broke stop trying to fix it. Small improvements with updates are welcomed, but a whole new app for us to download was a bit ridiculous! Also stop raising prices! You guys don't enough original or new content to justify going higher in price then you currently are!
Title: Why??

Content: I’ve been updating my review since May 2023 since the app changed. Now, I can’t update it anymore. It’s gone. It’s frustrating bc it was extensive— but fret not! I remember all my complaints :) here they are, enjoy:  September 2023 -I start my show, and it turns up as green. The contrast is completely messed up.  I have to go back to Home and restart it  -Also, when I pause and then unpause, it starts back up somewhere completely different.  -Also, I don’t see an option to remove shows from my History so that I can rewatch them—once it’s watched, and I want to rewatch it, I click an episode, and it goes to the very end of the episode which is where I stopped the last time I was watching. It’s a mess.  -Moreover, sometimes I start playing an episode and the screen doesn’t fit in my TV, it’s literally 4x the size of what it should be. - It also does this thing that if I click on my show from Continue Watching, it sometimes goes to blank black screen & plays audio from a different movie / show.  Previously, between May-August 2023, the app didn’t show the “Continue Watching” section properly (they fixed that).   They also had an issue where I had English CC turned on but it wouldn’t show up. The only way to make it show up would be going to Subtitles, choosing a different language CC, then choosing English CC again. And still, sometimes it wouldn’t show up. (This has been since fixed).  If I remember something I will for sure add. I am 99% sure most 5 star reviews must be paid, there’s no way so many people are happy, just read the other 1star reviews. Too. Many. Issues.   HBO messed up big time switching to this “MAX” app. Why fix something that wasn’t broken? Why did you get such a terrible team of incompetent app creators? I’ve never had that many issues with an app.
Title: Worst. App. In. the. history. Of. Mankind.

Content: Time Warner has managed to ruin all of the things that were good (or at least decent) about the experience from the HBO Max app on tvOS.  For starters, this should not have required a new app install, it should have just updated the old one in place given their plans to shut off access to the old app. Bad planning to foist that pain onto users for no good reason.  Now, getting to the actual app. It was a big controversy when HBO Max switched from the native tvOS player to its own custom inferior player, so they promptly reverted the change. So what does the new Max app do? Implement a far inferior custom player that doesn’t work with most of the basic built-in functions of the tvOS player or feel like an app designed for the platform. I would choose stronger words to analogize this but given it’s an App Store review, I’ll just say it’s downright insulting and user-hostile.  On top of that, for the first hour after I installed the app I couldn’t even get it to sign in and was getting server side errors when trying to view the “sign in with provider” page. Ugly black & white unbranded error pages full of technical jargon which should never be shown to users to begin with. This is how they decided to ship this broken, subpar app. I gave up and was fortunately able to sign in the following morning.  Fix your terrible app. If you’re going to build a custom player, it had better be incredibly good and come with all of the standard functionality of the built-in player. But since it’s clear your software team doesn’t have the capability of doing that, please just switch back to the built-in tvOS player. You will not do a better job designing a usable playback experience than what Apple has given you (basically nobody else does).
Title: Ruined everything that was good about HBO Max on tvOS

Content: MAX is a very good app and a place that can entertain you with all your classic TV shows and movies.But there is one thing I would love.I would like for MAX to bring back How The Grinch Stole Christmas.Because that is one of my classic Christmas movies and my favorite and for me to find out that they do not have it made me disappointed.But overall MAX is a pretty good app.

I’m okay with paying $19.99 a month for three screens to view at the same time. My brother, myself, and my nephew can all watch what we want without interference. Now they said they aren’t raising the price but they are dropping it to TWO SCREENS for $19.99?! How is charging $10 per screen per month not a price increase when it was $6.66 per screen per month before? This is ridiculous.
Title: Too expensive for what you get!

Content: There’s a bug in the app!! Very annoying one at that! It won’t let me se some rows  like , just added, continue watching or for you! Is just blanks
Title: November 10 2023

Content: Slight improvements but there are still a good number of shows that I still CANNOT cast to my TV’s. I have done all the resets on my end, resetting my chrome cast, sign out and sign in on my app, delete and re-download the app and still having trouble casting some shows. For example, there are also shows that won’t even cast to my TV and an “unexpected error” message will pop up onto the TV. When the “something went wrong” pops up when it has trouble casting to my TV it says “please try again. If the problem continues, visit BEAM.com/help” with the “if you contact us about this error, please include the following code” I don’t think that’s a real website, PLEASE look into this “beam.com” and fix it. Bugs still needs to be fixed and still needs more improvement. App is STILL randomly logging you out of the app for NO REASON.
Title: Version 2.2.0 problems

Content: There is no other app that makes you sign in more than MAX. Whyyyy
Title: Signing in all.the.time.

Content: Bought through YouTube Tv. Works as expected there however app on phone? Ha! I can’t see any titles! I have to press each black box to get a title… how annoying! It’s useless to me if I’m not home. Not worth the price. Discount it if I can only use 1/2 the service! Customer service? First one so flustered they “put me on hold” then hung up! Second call? With all the girls giggling in the background I had zero confidence in them being able to do anything and I was right! They “ escalated it to their tech team who will EMAIL me?!?!?!!! Dear Lord! Forget it! Just know what you’re buying is all I’m saying.
Title: Worst app ever!

Content: My app is acting up and I can’t read or see half of the screen. They sent me an email saying beginning December 5. It will stream only be in an HD and no longer and 4K no longer in Dolby Atmos. Will only allow me to sign in on two devices. everything has lowered and quality about this app. Funny they tell me this while the apps not functioning. FYI, I pay for a premium no add package and they started showing advertisements for media. They produced by Max ahead of my shows still finding a way to play ads even though I pay for no ad service. Cheesy. Actually, I am mostly finding great entertainment from my Hulu app. More and more Max is forcing changes and lowering the quality and usually doesn’t have anything that I want so if my review helps somebody to make a decision, then don’t buy in to Max. Look at all of your other choices, especially Hulu. Disney is available on Hulu I love my Disney+ app. I’m just trying to get the word out there. They’re doing this really slick right after taking over and making all these changes matter of fact that are nothing better for the customer.  I responded to the Max support that answered this review and filled out the request form and gave them permission to email me and to use my email. Now this morning that person sends me an email and said somebody else on our advanced team is looking at this and they will let you know if they have any questions or updates. But this person named Ronnie didn’t offer to help me at all but they made me think oh they care. I’m gonna respond but they didn’t do anything and now I got to feel like something would happen but it didn’t extra disappointing.
Title: Max has lowered the quality.

Content: I seriously get tired of all the same or wack movies. Netflix, Starz (especially Starz) Hulu, Showtime.. just to name a few.. Wack…  one day, I was going through my channels and there was a movie on Max that I have been searching for years to find but could not remember the name of the movie. So I subscribed to Max, not expecting much, oh boy was I wrong… not only do they have all the new movies but they have oldies but goodies that I have not seen in years. They also have all the best sitcoms of the 90s. I am hooked. I watch it almost everyday.
Title: So many good movies

Content: Love this app ! The best, always have good recommendations no matter what genre I choose. 10000000/10 <3
Title: The best app !

Content: Thei app was great it offered what you’d expect from a top their PAID app.  In Dec 5 2023 they will reduce from 3 devices at once to 2 , they will reduce resolution from upto 4K to hd only. This is on the AD -free version.  If it wasn’t paid by another party I’d consider others who have the same or similar at higher resolution for the money.  I understand band width is not infinite. But there seems to be a lot of streamers like hbo max who up price or reduce what was premium. Good thing for physical media. I’ll keep buying physical and let services like this go.
Title: Great becoming less then average

Content: I began tuning into NBA games on Max when they offered a complimentary sports package until February 2024. Given my preference for TNT broadcasts and the free access, it seemed like a great alternative to paying for YouTube TV.  However, my experience with watching sports on Max has been frustrating because it doesn't save my progress. It's frustrating to start from the beginning and manually navigate the progress bar to find where I left off.  Personally, I'm considering reactivating my YouTube TV subscription and discontinuing my Max membership. I would advise others planning to watch sports on Max to do the same.  It's definitely not providing a satisfactory user experience!
Title: Watching sports on this platform isn’t ideal.

Content: Alright Max is cool and all but the fact that you’re making us pay extra for 4K and dolby atmos is not cool. It’s stupid cuz $15.99 is already a lot for a streaming platform and now yall are having people pay more than that just to have the features they currently had before? What a way to rob people bruh yall are starting to look like netflix for real. be better max

Content: 10/29/2023 upd: it looks like the issue got fixed by the latest update. The app is still slow and in general not the best from the ux perspective , but at least it’s functional now. Thanks to devs!  —  It used to work with my chromcast from iPhone and iPad for very long time, and now it stopped. So annoying, every time you turn off screen and open it back the movie resets. The only way to watch is turning it on and then using Google Home app to pause and continue.
Title: Casting to chromecast is buggy with ios

Content: On Roku, crashes, lags and freezes constantly. 10 sec rew button use to do exactly that but now just acts as 2nd rew button. Every week or so won’t let you connect at all if you’re subscribing through a cable provider, no matter what you do, says either your cable plan doesn’t have max and/or you have to create an account (account wasnt necessary in the previous app) again. This last time had to create a new account with new email and all my lists and settings vanished lol. Newest bug (10/29/23) is that in the middle of watching an eppy it goes to a black screen and there’s nothing you can do to fix it, although other eppys of same series are fine to watch.  Literally a new bug every week, I kid you not…  Features vanished such as the “Hub” where you could go to DC and find that Batman movies without much searching. Now, you actually have to type it in lol. Or the Last Chance where you can see what’s leaving. Other features like Subtitles (which I use all the time) didn’t work at first but now do, hopefully. No other apps on iOS or Roku have any of these issues. None….  Their first rollout of the Max app was arguably the worst functional, streaming app ever, both on iOS and Roku, I thought at the time (now this one beats it). They eventually improved it to where it was decent. So sick of the changes with every new app. Have it as part of a mandatory cable subscription package in my co-op and would cancel in a sec if not for that
Title: Absolute s-show of an app now

Content: The app is just a dumping ground for content with no efficient way to navigate. Content suggestion leaves a lot to be desired.
Title: Is this app Max or Just a rebranded Amazon Prime Video

Content: Watching CNN live shows on HBO Max, is utterly ridiculous. Not only is there no way to pause a live show, even momentarily, it also cannot stay in sync with the picture in a picture supported on iOS. Returning to the HBO app causes live shows on CNN to wildly scam across the timestamps. There is also no tracking in the player, meaning that you will not be able to go back to where you were watching. It seems like the live aspect of CNN is an entirely true. It seems like ads are piped in locally to your device, causing you to be out of sync with the CNN broadcast.an app that has been remade so many times it’s not even funny, you would think that this could be the simplest of things. But like every other attempt, HBO has tried with streaming apps, it is another failure.
Title: HBO is bumbling the CNN partnership

Content: I've been in HBO subscriber for about 20 years and it's only been about two years since I cut the cable and I've been streaming everything. I had a feeling when HBO changed it its name to the dubious "Max" (way to tank a premium brand) that we were headed in a not great direction, but they have exceeded my expected disappointment. Every month, I pay $15 a month so that they can make no customer service directly available to me. I don't expect that for $15 a month. Over the course of a year that's a respectable amount of money. If you're going to change to a streaming platform, if times are changing in that direction, you have to change with it and that means that you have to have your own customer service available. Every time I'm watching something and the screen times out or the app is flatlined and then I click on it to go back into it, it starts what I'm watching back from the beginning. There are not words to describe my frustration. Now I feel like I have no choice but to get HBO through a provider like Hulu or Sling, or Amazon Prime, all of which are in my life in some way. I could cable because I wanted to be rid of that. I like to have options, so that if I'm not getting good customer service, I can leave. I don't like feeling trapped. You have taken away my option to go directly to the provider. I'm paying for this.
Title: Programming great, app glitchy, customer service nonexistent.

Content: I have free Max with my At&T account but it logs me out all the time!  Then it says I don’t have a subscription, it says I’m not authorized. I have to open and close the app several times in a row to get it to connect.  It also logs out of my Roku at least twice a day, then it wants me to scan a QR code with my phone and it says I’m not authorized.  Have to do that 3-4 times. When I finally get it to recognize my subscription, then it wants me to create a login name, then it says I already have an account but I have to check email to get a code.   This does not work for me when I’m at my lake house where there zero phone signal. I like to download things to watch when I’m there but if it logs me out I can’t recover my account.  Can you fix this please?

Content: I love the content provided however I have nothing nice to say about the functionality of the Max app itself. I use an android tv and without fail, anytime I pause the show, it freezes and the only fix is to uninstall and reinstall the app over and over. It's at the point where I'm about to cancel my membership because $16/month for this user experience is ridiculous. Need better talent apparently to design a functional app or I will no longer be a customer.
Title: Horrific Functionality on Streaming Devices

Content: The app on the iPhone needs some work. It can be difficult to navigate and sometimes resets you to the beginning of the episode. It also doesn’t always go to the next episode if you pause it near the end of the episode. There are some good shows on HBO max but I think some more quality shows are needed to keep up with Netflix and Hulu
Title: Review of HBO max

Content: It cost a bit much but it has a bunch of good shows I can’t watch on Netflix or YouTube
Title: Good

Content: I’ve used hbo max and max all together and have never experienced this much trouble casting. In order for an episode to play I’d have to stay on the application, if I were to check a text the episode would either load from the beginning or stop casting all together. It’s terribly inconvenient and really upsetting. Hoping the next update fixes these issues. I’ve tried trouble shooting and it still happens consistently. I’m able to cast Amazon prime Hulu and Netflix just fine and I don’t have to keep signing in. When the transition from HBO max to max occurred I didn’t mind it since everything was going smoothly but it’s been prevalent that the performance is declining and the app is no longer user friendly. I Wish they’d go back to hbo max. I don’t tend to write bad reviews although it’s like they hired new grads to restructure the whole system. Nonetheless they could have spent more time the app rather than launching it when it clearly has more work to be done.
Title: Trouble casting

Content: I had to update my HBO Max app today (10/8/23) because it was the only way to continue using it. I never had a problem with the app...until now. I've watched two shows today, and both dropped several times and reset to the beginning. This happened when I needed to pause the program but also just out of the blue. Very frustrating.
Title: Latest Update is Problematic

Content: I can’t even remember how many times I’ve tried to log into this account through our provider, but it never works. It is my moms account, but I love at home with her. It always tells me that I cannot sign in with a secondary account device or whatever. It is very frustrating, because I am a full time college student and work a full time job, so when I’m up/around, my mom’s sleeping - and vice versa so it’s hard to connect with her to log in on her phone to try to fix this mess. ( because every time the code gets sent to her phone, it says “ It looks like you're trying to sign in to HBO Max with a secondary Xfinity ID”  Besides that, I love the shows and movies that are provided by “max” like euphoria and chuck.   Just wish it was a little more user friendly - at least to log in !  And I would just get my own account to prevent these issues... but not in this economy.
Title: Annoying if it’s not directly your account !

Content: How is hbo max the worst streaming app ? Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, prime video, YouTube all work completely fine. But HBO max has so many problems you don’t even know where to start. First off the buffering. It is impossible to watch movies on it because it buffers every minute or so. And now, while watching tv shows it has started to constantly restart from the beginning. Oh and btw there are no problems while showing ads. But while showing actual content it is pretty much unusable. The new “app” and the updates did nothing. Why would you want to claim to support a platform (iOS) if you can’t create an app which is actually unusable in that platform ? Just take the app off the App Store and let customers decide if they still want to use your service.

Content: I watch max literally every single day all day long, I don’t do a single other thing but watch movies and shows on max. I’ve stopped going to work, I don’t talk to my friends or family. I just watch max all day long, my grandma actually tried to tell me that hooloo was better than max, I told her she was dead to me and to never bother calling me again or I’d take legal action against her. My brother suggested I should watch some idiotic horse dung series on turdflix a few weeks ago, I kicked him out of my house and told him exactly what I think of him and his moronic suggestion. Basically watching stuff on there is the one and only thing I value, I don’t care about my pets, I don’t care about my ex wife, I don’t care about my red headed kids, I don’t care about who the president is or whatever horse crap war is going on in god knows where…I just want to watch blade 2 or Batman forever and be left alone. 5 stars all day 5 stars all night 5 stars even if my house is on fire 5 stars even if there’s a home invasion 5 stars if I get attacked my a pack of wild dogs 5 stars if my drunk alcoholic granddaddy gets drunk on stump liquor and runs up in my house with a bootcher knife at 3am. 5 5 5 5 5 stars every day of my life no matter what happens no matter what anyone thinks or says or does now and forever. I don’t care if a nuke literally hits in 30 seconds, 5 stars in ever possible way until the end of time. Do you understand? Can you even grasp what im saying? Listen directly to me, FIVE STARS. I’d pay any price no matter how high to have MAX I don’t care if I had to sell all my clothes and furniture, I’d sit in the floor naked and watch my shows.

That is including if I close the app look at Netflix and then go back to max I have to sign in again. EVERY TIME. I’ve checked my settings on all devices but no matter what I do I have to continuously sign in sometimes multiple times a day. If it wasn’t for the fact that max has better options than Netflix and Hulu I would have gotten rid of it.

Content: So this was a great app prior to converting to Max. Now as I’m trying to scroll through and select things I can’t tell what my tv cursor is on. It tends to be the show right below what is on the screen. 9 times out of 10 I get frustrated from trying to watch a show and other shows popping up that I leave the app and go to Hulu, Netflix, or another app of the like. I just want an easy experience and to pull up the show I’m actually interested in watching. It really shouldn’t be a guessing game. Especially for 19.99 a month + tax. Please find a fix for this!
Title: What am I even looking at?

Content: I was very pleased with HBO MAX since its launch—great value, great content, good features good picture quality. However, MAX hasn’t live up to its promise. Too many bugs and the 4K Dolby Vision is mediocre—just compare the Dolby Vision version of AVATAR on Disney+ and you’ll see what I’m talking about. Ok, we got the addition of Discovery networks (though no one was asking for it), but after removing 4K Dolby Vision access from the ad-free $15.99 subscription, it is no longer a good value. HBO still offers good content, but  $19.99 for Max Ultimate and access to 4K is too expensive to keep for more than a month. We didn’t ask Warner/Discovery to bring their cable networks to HBO and charge a cable premium. I can’t imagine how much these streaming services are going to charge once their CEOs are forced to share their piece of the pie with the writers and actors who can’t even afford to pay for streaming services themselves.

Title: Fire people

Content: i have always appreciated how smooth HBO’s apps ran - no matter which platform HBOGO, HBO NOW, etc. i wish i could say the same about the new MAX. i couldn’t even use the service the first month as the my tv app would not recognize my password despite several resets - and was not offered any recompense! -and now that i finally can watch on my tv there is audio difficulty. 70% of the time i have to restart an episode to get sound to work. closed captions do not work at all! HBO apps used to have the most reliable captions, please fix these issues. pandering to a wider audience isn’t worth losing your existing customer base due to a lack of the quality we have come to expect.  8/27/23 UPDATE: downgrading to ONE STAR as most of the previous issues still occur, and some new ones have been added. when playback is paused then resumed it will start anywhere from 5 minutes back up to restarting the video completely. leaving an episode to finish later results in a black screen - it will not play at all. in your rush to scoop up some proverbial fat cash from consumers, you have neglected to provide a product that is worth paying for! Netflix charges almost half as much, and their service works pretty well most of the time. honestly service this is not worth the money even at the “with ads” level as it is pretty much impossible to watch anything on it without some sort of frustrating issue.

Thanks, it was nice seeing the end credits of the loony tunes for a day.

Really frustrating- Netflix, Hulu, Apple TV, Peacock all work much better with this.

Content: I swear that doing updates for this app are dangerous -- For my mental health!!!  The app has always been squirrelly, but since updating it this week, it has destroyed "my list" because it destroyed my "profile".  Now I get to create everything all over again and it won't have record of what seasons I've watched already.  Is it because some managerial types decided to force users to create profiles for "adults" or "children"?  No that max really offers much for children anyhow, not that I know since I don't have any of those no-neck monsters.  I was hoping that this app would be better than accessing HBO through Amazon Prime, but I was sorely wrong.  How many developers does it take for MAX app to perform well?  Obviously more than the company is paying for -- or it is some idiotic decision to make redesign AND destroy what the user has already set up  This app is beyond annoying. Title: 5 STARS

Content: This is an issue I did not face on the old HBO Max app, but face now on Max. In any shows, most recently White Lotus and Succession, transitions between scenes result in the video and audio stuttering. For example, in Succession this would happen when a shot changes from inside the office to birds eye footage of the city— big changes between scenes, not just two cameras switching. It only seems to happen on the iPhone application and is fine on my TV.   Furthermore, the 10 sec rewind button is mostly useless. It doesn’t work like Netflix, Prime, Youtube, or Hulu. Clicking it multiple times registers as a single 10 second skip back. On Max, I have to wait for the video to render, then click the button again in order to rewind 20 seconds, while on every single other service I can spam click and actually see the video render instantly, AND see a “-10”, “-20”, “-30”, etc with every spam click to know exactly how far back i’m rewinding.   Fix this and I change my review because the content is actually good on this platform but the mobile app lacks in performance.
Title: Video playback stutters and 10 sec rewind button needs tuning.

Content: HBOMax used to be my go to streaming service, I’d use it pretty much everyday and I still believe Max is the greatest streaming service out there. Even though HBOMax it did remove a couple shows I love from the Hanna Barbera catalog the both contain an insanely high quality selection of content with an easy to navigate interface. Being in a long distance relationship SharePlay and Max allowed me and my partner to be able to quickly and conveniently pop on one of our favorite shows, South Park being a big favorite. However that changed when the transition to Max came. I pretty much check every other week now hoping it’ll finally be back, and if it does I’ll edit this review to a five star one. My use of the app has since plummeted for Hulu and Paramount Plus, but I’m still holding out hope that the feature will be restored.

The infamously slow Disney plus run faster and better on my devices. It’s not my internet as the app does run great on my phone using Wi-Fi. I’ve also gone through trouble shooting with my internet provider and they’ve determined there is nothing wrong with my internet. This new version was an epic fail — please fix it.

Content: Max is the same price as Hulu ad-free and I think the content is better.  I like the documentaries from CNN and the classic films on TCM as well as HBO Originals.  I can only afford to have one paid subscription and for me, this is the best choice.  The annual subscription is a nice price break.  My only criticism is the Discovery networks.  For one thing, they already have Discovery+ and it seems to be a duplication; it also targets a different demographic group than the typical HBO customer. Title: Impossible to link to Hulu

Content: The amount of issues that come from trying to using any HBO streaming is migraine worthy. If you get it “for free” through other services, you’ll be for a doozy if a time. For the past few months, my iPhone was randomly logged out while my iPad and Xbox series X MAX apps were fine but my phone kept refusing to log in, telling me I had to update my password. Finally after getting past that screen and logging in, I was met with a new message saying I wasn’t a subscriber. About 3 weeks ago, finally got past that issue. Well, it’s happening again but this time my phone works, my Xbox works but my iPad is giving me the same message runaround that my phone gave me for months. I try connecting to my subscriber and it won’t progress from the login screen. How and/or why is it so hard to have a simple login ID for subscribers who get it through other services (such as AT&T). Why does this only affect one device at a time? Why does it tell me that I’m not a subscriber when I use the login MAX made us create some months back? HBO Go was terrible, HBO Now was terrible, HBO Max was terrible and MAX is somehow the worst. HBO’s streaming apps is like the Bethesda Game Studios Creation Engine, same junk from years ago just updated to be made worse each time
Title: Horrible streaming app

Content: Thai app is terrible. I honestly never write reviews, but this app is straight up trash.   I have to re-login almost every time I open the app, no matter what device I’m using. I can’t simply just login either, I’m usually already logged in, it just states that I no longer have a subscription which I clearly do. Upon logging out, I am forced to not just log back in with my email and password the APP MADE ME MAKE, but noooo, I have to reconnect my provider and get a one time code, and then maybe the app still won’t even work!! Having to login 2-3 times and very this provider and do this and that… SOOO STUPID!!! I have a username and password, I should be able to log into the app. Period. Anytime. Anywhere.   Terrible and frustrating.

Content: Literally can take 5 minutes to watch one minute worth of video due to non stop buffering. Mouth movement also doesn’t match up to words. This app is infuriating. Max has some of the best content but there’s no way I’m paying for it when I can’t even get through a single episode. I have very high speed internet and I subscribe to all the streaming apps and I don’t have a single issue with any of them except for Max. Please upgrade your severs or risk losing the majority of your customers. A simple google search and  Reddit threads show that this is a widespread issue and your customer base is over it and unwilling to pay any longer when it’s impossible to even get through a single episode. (For example, I’ve been trying to watch an episode for over an hour and have only made it through 15 minutes of a show because it is buffering every. single.word) It is beyond frustrating.

Content: The original HBOMax is always buggy and awful. The downloads feature doesn’t work most of the time. The downloads feature however is still buggy and a worthless feature. I downloaded a few movies and docuseries in the hopes of watching them while traveling where there’s no access to the internet like airport, mountains, etc., and I just keep getting a black screen with buffering, a spinning circle in the middle of the screen, upon clicking the movie or documentary followed by an error warning and that to try again. This is very frustrating and I know it’s not due to my iPhone since the other apps such as Disney Plus, Netflix and Amazon are working fine. Please ask your developers to fix this issue. From reading the reviews, it appears that this is an ongoing issue.

Title: Fun new and interesting

Content: New app is as frustrating as it was with the HBO app. Closes for no reason, doesn’t always save what you’re watching, very slow and buggy. I’m going back to paying for max/hbo on Amazon. We have zero issues using my son’s HBO membership on Amazon. Then you dropped off Amazon and we were forced to use yours. Super disappointing. Glad the channel is now available on other platform again. And it’s not an IP or Wi-Fi, download or device issue. We work from home and each of our offices are outfitted with their own connections with very fast business fiber optic, and everything else loads properly and doesn’t just quit working. One of us works as a backend engineer developer and a senior software engineer. and it’s easy as pie at keeping everything running beautifully and super fast. Not that you care, We’re sticking with Amazon and if you lock us out of third party streaming again, we’re done.

Title: The original was better

Content: HBO is known for producing some of the most entertaining and captivating media in the last 30 years. It is a full on shame that they have been sullied by this app.   If you want to watch your favorite HBO shows and movies, find a used DVD store and buy them there. You’ll find that experience easier and more fulfilling than dealing with this piece of trash app. The UI is glitchy. The “continue watching” feature is hit and miss. Their tech integrations with smart devices is still “in progress” (good thing they only had a year to prepare for this).   Also note, if you pay for this service anywhere other than their website, the customer service agents will have no ability to assist you in any billing issues. Furthermore, they will refuse any refund requests out of hand as they claim none are offered for any reason.   If you think you want to pay for this, reconsider and, if you still want it - go seek help because obviously you shouldn’t be in charge of your own finances. This app is a waste of money and lacks any type of redeeming qualities.   AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Title: Worst Streaming Service

So it would be better if all of the movies that start with “the” were actually where most people would assume they’d be. Because most of us were taught that in elementary school.

Content: Better than other services like Hulu because it all comes in ad free and at a cheaper price (has TLC without needing to pay for Live TV) than so much of the competition, the recent merge making MAX has put in so much binge worthy content and made it more than just a good movies app, has much more quality control than Netflix everything on here being a complete banger, wouldn’t trade MAX for anything else at this point

Content: Every time I open this app I have to log in again. It doesn’t save username or password so you have to input your credentials manually several times per day.
Title: Buggiest hbo app yet

Content: Update based on support feedback- Are either of those links gonna show me how to fix your Klimt app that makes you click 3-4 different places just to rewatch an episode? Because if not…you literally just failed again 🫤🫠  Having assisted with app developments myself, I have NO idea why HBO (or whatever their name is now - I don’t care) would not have had a more thorough beta testing. One would think that would’ve helped catch the many glitches I’m immediately experiencing - and would’ve also possibly helped fixed the poor UX. For one, every time I try to play episodes, after a few I just get an error message saying “something went wrong” with some long useless piece of code. Then it says “visit the help center” - which, not shockingly, is completely useless. Then, if you’re someone who say - has kids - and those kids like to watch episodes of their favorite shows over again, it is multiple steps to get it started whereas with the old HBO app, you just hit play and you were ready to go. This app isn’t by far not an improvement. It’s awful!
Title: Tons of glitches, many steps for playback 👎

Content: Can’t even use it on ipad2 anymore. Why is there no support for old devices? Netlix, amazon run work fine....
Title: Backward compatibility.?

Content: I’ve used every streaming app you could think of and Max is pretty terrible. I’ve had nothing but complications simply trying to watch on my tv since it has switched to “MAX”. I don’t understand why I pay $16 a month for this borderline passable service. Y’all need to step it up HBO because I’m only keeping y’all for LotR anyway. I’ve used he process of elimination to remedy this for about three days now and after an hour of being patient, I just switch to YouTube. Be prepared for a sub par streaming app, folks! It boggles my brain people have left 5 stars LOL
Title: Not great at all.

Content: Ever since switching from the old HBO Max app to the new one, I have been unable to cast to my Chromecast. It gives me an error saying it’s unable to cast the content (with no actual error code) and nothing works.
Title: Unable to cast since switching!

Content: I challenge you to tell me why a progressively worse version of this app needs to be rebuilt every 2-3 years. Please please please focus on making content instead of rebranding and rebuilding a bad app. We went from an app full of color gradients that made it impossible to see which part of the screen my cursor was focused on. Now we have a hideous gray app where I still can’t figure out the element I’m focused on that floods you with pop up messages as soon as you open it for the first time. At this point it’s just easier to cancel my subscription and buy a dvd box set of the shows I like. You’re sending us all back to 2010!
Title: Please stop remaking the same app

Content: This app doesn't work I can't log into my account. Trying to recover my account gives me Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. 94792d11-62f3-4af5-bae5-866ab6efed73-hboMax-e4387f15-94c7-4395-8a22-f89b23ec97ac I contacted HBO support and they told me they get a notification when trying to access my account and therefore are unable to provide support. Asked Apple for a refund as I paid one year in advance end of April will know in 48 hours if they approve it. Pretty disappointed I'm not getting any support from HBO.
Title: Doesn't work and no support

Content: I miss the old colors,the purple was so calming,this blue sucks👎🏽
Title: Disappointed

Content: They have removed so many features :( The worst for me is that the continue to watch feature doesn’t work unless you haven’t watched the show before. If you’ve binge watched Friends 1000000 times and go back for a rewatch like I have, there is no way to know where you left off. So sad. I loved HBO Max.
Title: Bring back old app

Content: Constantly logs out on Smart TV & personal devices & desktop, forcing me to rescan code & sign back in, sometimes multiple times a day.  It just stinks.
Title: Worse than the old app, which was awful.

Content: Never had an out-of-sync sound issues with the HBO app, do not have this type of issues with Hulu, Netflix, YouTube, Vudu, Tubi, Crackle, Disney or Peacock, yet on the new Max app sound constantly goes out of sync at the beginning of continuously played show episodes requiring me to exit and restart almost every episode sometimes more than three times until sound finally syncs up.   Issue is encountered on a Sony Android TV.
Title: Sound often out of sync

Content: Bye bye. I refuse to pay $15.99 and not watch in 4k. I have too many other options to pay HBO for this non 4k subscription.  I watch most of my content on YouTube anyway. It was nice knowing you.
Title: $15.99 a month no 4k

Content: I’ll start by saying I have all services from Netflix, Starz, Hulu, even Disney as well as others and I always recommend HBOMax now Max all the time from the wide range of things they put out to some of their own original shows honestly one of the best tv providers apps in the business for years and it’s older then me just thought I leave a review because they’ve never let me down to show how much I appreciate them lol

Content: Don’t like the interface as compared to before. Even though people complained about the old app I like it better. It was easier to find movies there. Before in the previous app you could see last chance videos which were leaving the hbo streaming service soon. Can’t see/find those now. Plus unlike Netflix & Amazon prime the # of suggestions it gives for movies is not nearly enough. I know hbo has a lot lot of movies in their catalog. Many were on previous app. Those are probably there now but can’t easily find. Plus when I watch on phone the screen automatically rotates upside down sometimes.

Title: Awful

Content: I haven’t been able to watch a single thing without issue. Turns off with an error message every 10-15 minutes.  Update: it’s even worse. Audio doesn’t sync with video. It doesn’t remember your place or what you’ve watched. Only things I watched on hbo app are still there anything new it dumped. I called customer service. Put in the huge 15 character error code twice then was told that they have no clue what it means. I was repeatedly told to do the same troubleshooting over and over.   It’s a dumpster fire. Content: Love the.entertainment
Title: Love the app

Content: when watching any video the ipad dock doesn’t disappear as it does with other apps like youtube or netflix.
Title: iPad Dock doesn’t disappear

Content: I have just every streaming service with HBO included with Comcast. Why is it so impossible to connect the Xfinity HBO plan at $15.99 to access the app? Yes, like everyone I have four emails so it’s not possible to keep the log ins consistent across the Apple accounts, Comcast, and new streaming platforms. It just shouldn’t be this difficult to connect one thing to another. Go and HBO MAX worked so what doesn’t “MAX?”
Title: Totally Botched

Content: Little things that other content providers have allowed, or, yanno, had basically given at a level 1 company. The ability to choose what episode you watch when you choose the show. The little things they require level 1 programming but somehow HBO Max can’t get their stackers to code. It plays the most recent episode, then you have to back out to watch what episode you wanted. This is all over the app. They wanted their poor reviews hidden by forcing a “different app, completely” to be downloaded. HBO max is no longer an app. It’s this. Had to delete my old app to download this. Hide their poor previous reviews behind a new app where they can start anew. Otherwise this would get a 3/5 just cuz holy crap what are we paying for? This price for a half made app? How little do you pay your programmers? 1/5 for their blatant lying and a 3/5 for their overall app.
Title: Bad app for a bad company

Content: I love HBO, Max or Max in so many different ways. First they have all of those movies that just came out of the movie theater that everyone wants to watch. Second It’s only $10 a month with ads included which is nothing compared to the other streaming platform such as Netflix or Hulu. Third I love the vase options that you can choose from. They have way more options in every single category than I’ve seen on a lot of streaming platforms. I will definitely be keeping my subscription!!! I also highly recommend this if you wanna have one or two streaming platforms that are affordable that have a ton of shows and movies on them! You will for sure get your moneys worth.
Title: Max is unlike any other streaming platform

Content: I understand the need to stay relevant. However instead of improving it’s gotten worse. (If it ain’t broken don’t fix it).   Plenty to watch on this platform but I can’t stand the “updates”. Nothing gets saved in continue watching and it won’t show episodes I’ve watched so I don’t know what episode I left off on! let alone the name of the new shows I start.   I’m a busy person and I love convenience. If I get the chance to sit down after a 24 hour shift at the ems station, I’d prefer if the UI didn’t piss me off.   This applies to the Roku app as well.
Title: Pointless

Content: Once again I was out offshore and unable to use the Max app formerly known as HboMax. This app constantly has issues offshore, the offline mode for downloads is terrible. This time it was a constant error saying we don’t offer HBO in your area when I have a paid subscription!! Why have customers pay to for downloads only to be unable to watch them when they need to (without internet). The most frustrating thing is, Amazon, Netflix, Disney, NONE of these other companies charge for downloads. Not only do they not charge they are always available when you don’t have service. There are to many options at this point to have to deal with these issues on a regular basis. I’ve left feedback multiple times and nothing has changed. Time to leave HBO
Title: Same Trash New Name

Content: If it’s not broken, don’t try and fix it. This is supposed to be an improved upgrade. I have had nothing but issues. The old HBO was better with zero issues. I downloaded the app, it worked for a short moment. & now I'm locked out. It's telling me to contact the provider & submit a code. All of this happened while I'm in the middle of watching a program. And my provider is closed for today. Very frustrating.
Title: Connection issues

Content: I switched from Spotify because this subscription was so bad it wasn’t worth free HBO. The HBO app to MAX was terrible not usable or worth my money. Picture is delayed and half the time doesn’t work. I can’t believe Spotify actually thought I would pay them for HBO combo.  What a joke just lower the price and ditch HBO?!?!
Title: Worst paid app in history

Content: I hate the new blue color format, the purple was so pretty HBO actually used to be the nicest looking streaming service, now it just looks like a combination of amazon and disney plus. Super boring grey and blue, does not draw me in or make me wanna stay. The purple was fine or some nice orange hues would be cool like a sunset vibe.
Title: BLUE??

Content: I used to love HBO and now it’s about as aggravating as Hulu is for me.   First of all, when I watch hbo max on my home tv, it never saves my place in my tv series. I literally have so scroll through seasons and episodes to find where I left off. EVERY SINGLE TIME. That is unacceptable. No other streaming service does that.   Second of all, my recently watched is different from home tv to my cell phone’s recently watched EVEN THOUGH ITS THE SAME EXACT ACCOUNT?!?? I used to watch hbo allll the time off my phone, but I’ve noticed recently that when I click on the app it doesn’t have a true “most recently watched”  So once again I’m having to look up what I’ve recently watched.   And third of all the actually streaming of tv and movies glitches a lot.  From the sound going out to it being stuck on loading for minutes at a time  So my over all use of “MAX” is way too complicated and time consuming just to watch a 30 minute episode! I’m very disappointed.   And on side note WHY CHANGE THE COLOR?!?? I love the purple.
Title: Lame

Content: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhy
Title: To the Max

Content: Clunky clunk clunky. As in when I’m watching a movie/series as it cuts to the next scene it’ll start that glitch looping thing it does like a record skipping,So then I have to fast forward a couple minutes to get past the problem, that’s a no go. Let’s see here’s another one -your option selection is ridiculous I’ll explain. On the first of the month I went online to see what’s new on max this month and many’s sights show the exact content coming out (there’s plenty of content but none of it worth a crap) so when I go to the max app itself and look under just added there’s maybe 7 new movies or shows that pop up? Where’s the rest?  At least hbomax showed you all the new content on the app itself. Speaking of content and this is where it gets real bad. A documentary on Mary Tyler Moore…. Yea I’m serious. I’m 44 and that’s waaay for before my time. From what I’ve been hearing max wants to attract a younger audience that was the point of this big merger from what I’ve read. But ok.  Here’s another-Donna summer documentary… omg are you serious? I’m mid 40s and i barely know who this is.But you keep attracting that younger audience I’m rolling my eyes. And the commercials have gotten longer and more frequent no doubt another no go. On the bright side I just have 2 more weeks and I’ll be rid of this nonsense for good but I think I might just demand a refund.  Ps. I was on prime the other day and found a movie I liked but the only way to watch was to rent it or subscribe to Cinemax so I’m like cool I have max so it should be on there right?? Yea no not even close because that would make to much sense.  Pss. Checking out some free streaming apps I have and there’s equal to better content than max. Yea the free ones.  Psss. Mary Tyler Moore and Donna summers are great but I hope you understand my point.
Title: Complete trash

Content: The hbo max app had its own problems, but this app seems to have carried them over and adopted problems from other online streaming apps. I’m someone who regularly revisits certain episodes, and they make it inconvenient to revisit. I also am not fond of the linear way to view episodes rather than a grid. It also has the same exact error screen upon opening. (All I have to do is press the back button and it works) but you’d think that would be fixed with something different than just a similar error code. All in all, I was very comfortable with the original app and then they went and changed it in a way I’d imagine was an attempt to appeal to the masses without actually asking them. TLDR: I don’t mind the update, but I wish they had actually improved it instead of making it worse. I understand why the initial ratings were so low now.
Title: Ugh 😒

Content: Mark Zamora gill
Title: Called Is Max be it on YouTube how do doing all classic stuff like this a

Content: I’m trying to figure out why HBO feels like they need 10 different streaming apps. 🤷‍♂️ we honestly just need one app with Disney, HBOMAX, paramount, Hulu an Netflix. I’m tired of downloading a new apps every6 months cuz some of these companies think they are doing something smart.
Title: So confused

Content: First of all the app is so hard to use especially on tv. I’m just trying to watch friends as I do every night before I go to bed but N.O. it doesn’t show up on continue watching and when I go to it manually says to watch season one episode 1 again. HBO max was a much better app and max downgraded a trillion times.
Title: BRING BACK HBO, max S.U.C.K.S.

Content: Every time I try to cast there is a connectivity issue and an error code on screen “unexpected error trying to cast content”. Unfortunately, even after the content connects, the error is still on the screen. I have to disconnect from casting and reconnect for the error to go away. Two minutes later, it happens again and I have to go through it all over again. I don’t think I’ve been able to get through a single 1 hour episode of a show.
Title: Constant casting issues

Content: I always had trouble with this when it was HBOMax. Whether it was in my roku or my phone so wifi or no wifi my shoes would take forever to load or say there was an error try again later. That got super annoying. Now it seems to load faster on my roku and my phone. Guess all it needed was a new color scheme. There does seem to be a bug though. I don’t know if anyone else has had this problem, but whenever I exit out of it and step away from watching a show everytime I come back what I was currently watching isn’t in the list of continue watching. It’s a pain in the butt to hunt it down not to mention try and remember what part of the show I was on or what episode I was even on! I hope they get that fixed.
Title: New face and everything seems faster

Content: I enjoyed  HBO max better. I do not like the new title of max.As it shows it looks like Primes streaming  format and just looks sloppy and cheap like design. Also the streaming of Max title sounds very generic and not special.Hbo max design off the app I was much satisfied with it made it organized and convenient. Even when streaming shows on my phone.While the selection of shows and movies is still good. How a app is designed takes a further step to streaming especially in the comfort of our favorite shows.
Title: Hbo max is better

Content: First I wanna say the new look is amazing! Second, I’m so happy with the new add ons! More choices and good ones at that. It’s definitely not like the other as in Netflix, Hulu, etc. Definitely an upgrade, keep the good movies and shows coming!
Title: Detailed Review

Content: Never seen a company release new software that is actually a downgrade from its predecessor. I haven’t noticed any new content, but there are a plethora of new bugs that create a truly terrible user experience. Seems like devs copy pasted code from HBO Max, slapped random strings in it, and called it a day. No debugging/unit testing just let it rip. I think AMC+ has a superior ux now, which is hilarious because AMC+ seems like it was built in ‘95.
Title: MAX is just HBO MAX with a bunch of bugs

Content: Thanks for stealing my 4k, Max! You simply change the name of the app and poof, you get to downgrade a service that was paid for a year in advance. Amazing!
Title: Legacy ad free is code for 4K free

Content: Way to many ads for paying $10 a month even free YouTube doesn’t have as many ads as this crap.
Title: Too many ads

Content: TimeWarner-Discovery bought HBO and here’s the finished product. Another downgrade to something that was perfectly fine. Increase in subscription price by now offering what used to be offered to everyone at the $15.99 rate to $20.  How about all these board member approved choices actually take into consideration customer enjoyment of the product. Stop focusing on maximizing profits. I’m tired of everything getting gutted to keep investors and board members happy.  Ps. Pay your writers. Your office workers. The app developers. They actually deserve it.
Title: Corporate greed ruined this app

Content: Might as well be watching cable. YouTube has nothing on the number of ads in this app, and they’re all for HBO max shows, I’m already using the app just let me watch the stuff you’re making
Title: So many ads

Content: Ive noticed that when I use max on my amazon TV rhat the movie typically bugs out and freezes on me. Backing out of the movie and then resuming usually helps, but it does get a bit irritating. Also, when Im using Max on my TV, It gives me the option to pick categories, but not to choose between tv shows vs movies.
Title: Bugs, categories

Content: The app has too many restrictions compared to other streaming apps  1) There is no IMDB or other ratings available for titles 2) There is no way to watch video in a vertical orientation. Sometimes it is necessary. It only works horizontally 3) There is no way to mark a video as Unwatched or Watched 4) The app doesn’t work with external iPad keyboard, i.e. I can’t pause/resume video by pressing space button.   All of this works in Netflix, YouTube, etc.
Title: Not flexible

Content: Works well. Good content. Good price
Title: Works well. Good content. Good price

Content: I can’t finish my show because the last 2 weeks of my subscription I get errors 90% of the time after the new max update after spending hours talking to multiple seriously unhelpful support people (some would leave after not being able to help with no warning just a pop up of who I’m talking to now) after following some of there multiple “solutions” I now only get errors when trying to watch my show and after more days of talking to support and export support My subscription is running out but I can’t get a refund I paid to deal with a bull shi app with bull shi support people. Seems like they spent more money on these fake reviews the making the update work.

Content: Easy to operate and reliable.no matter the weather 😅

Content: It’s so annoying that the taskbar will not go away when watching a movie. Netflix and Hulu makes the iPhone task bar go away. Fix it!

Content: It is soooooooooooooooooooooooo  good
Title: I 🩷 max

Content: The HBO Max app was great. I never had any issues on any of my devices. This MAX app is awful….it never saves any of the shows I’ve been watching under “Continue Watching,” and when I search for the shows it still hasn’t saved my place in the movie/series. I can’t even get the mobile app to work because it keeps crashing and they claimed to have “login options” for the TV app (which, for most TV apps this means you can use your phone to sign in or scan a QR code or whatever)….the only actual option was to sign in using your TV remote with your username and password. That’s fine, but then don’t label it as “options.” I think they were probably rushed developing this app, because it clearly wasn’t ready.
Title: Not ready to launch

Content: Hello, managers of the formerly HBO max now Max app. I recently convinced a certain someone to download Max as a means for long distance movie nights to keep the connection flowing despite our distance. I was sorely disappointed though... Unfortunately, the app had been rebranded to Max by the time I convinced this certain someone to download the app. I had faith, this was not the right move.  Perhaps I should have convinced her to download Hulu instead, Hulu still has their shareplay feature intact. I do not understand why the shareplay feature is no longer part of this organization and I would like answers as soon as possible. Better yet, I would like a solution. This adjustment could possibly wreak havoc on my relationship and i am not ready for that, Max. Please, get back to me. Sincerely, Violet W. A.
Title: Shareplay is no longer available...

Content: Terrible credits
Title: Terrible credits

Content: My family loved using the old HBOMax app, but with the move to Max app, all the English subtitles are no longer available on any to shows or movies and we only have the option of Spanish subtitles or no subtitles. This is unacceptable and if it’s not resolved within a couple days, we will be canceling our subscription and sticking with our Netflix and Amazon Prime accounts which DO have English subtitles.
Title: English subtitles are completely gone with Max move

Content: New app often tells me I don’t have strong enough Wi-Fi, blurry images for several minutes at a time. Yet other streaming services Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ play their content just fine. Thinking of dropping this as it’s too expensive anyway. Right after I Finnish watching Game of Thrones and The Big Bang Theory.
Title: Change

Content: Hopefully there’s a bug fix update coming soon because this app is a horrible poop show. It glitches a lot it buffers or it pauses then starts randomly.
Title: Glitchy & Cheaply Made

Content: Just wish there were more selections especially if I’m paying for a subscription! Feel like other apps have more selection! Like Hulu and netflix
Title: Selection review!

Content: This is not letting me watch HARRY POTTERRRRRRR AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
Title: Hbo

Content: Not only does this app stink of corporate greed, but it runs worse than a toaster. No closed captioning for majority of titles, crashes constantly, piss poor quality, and lack of good titles. I wish hbo kept to its quality.
Title: Trash App, Pay your writers

Content: Bye
Title: Hulu Removed As Provider

Content: Awesome
Title: Awesome

Content: Great great, great great great. Great great great?!
Title: GREAT

Content: Series episodes and movies don’t automatically restart when the content has already been watched (or when almost toward the end) as they have and should.My wife rewatches Curb episodes to fall asleep to every night but now we have to go and manually restart every episode beforehand; otherwise, it will pick up on the ending credits and go to the next episode which also picks up on the ending credits. It continues in this way without watching a single episode. This is an amateur streaming service mistake; I’m surprised HBO missed this. Fix it or get out. Stop changing a good thing to a worse thing.
Title: I already hate it.

Content: I absolutely love that two amazing streaming services have became ONE!!!!! OMG doing this makes things so much easier because I really hate having hundreds of different streaming platforms to try and keep up with. Having HBOMax & Discovery+ is a dream come true. You’ve become the what all the other streaming services need to do because in the future I truly hope Paramount+ & Peacock combine then Hulu & Netflix combine.  When two services become one it makes things much, much, much, simpler. So thank you HBO and Discovery+ you’ve made streaming things so much better.
Title: MAX!!!!!!!

Content: So for about week I haven’t been able to access my subscription that I have through Hulu and now it’s working. The app looks decent so I’ll give it a shot but it’s pretty bad that I couldn’t log in in all that time until now.
Title: shaky start but it works

Content: Compared to Amazon prime, with its X Ray feature that gives links to actors work on the platform, trivia, continuity errors and quick responses… MAX seems very dated, even with this improvement. With all the search, AI etc out there - this could easily be a delightful, custom experience - but once you get past sone top level carousels and category rows - it’s like trying to sort out DVDs in the discount bin.
Title: Great content/sub-par UI

Content: Everyone I talk to says that the interface looks fuzzy and not as clean as it was on HBO max.Another thing is on all my devices the picture glitches out and turns different colors it’s just horrible please fix it.
Title: Buggy and interface is fuzzy

Content: Love this service the only thing that is missing is the show and lizard lick towing. Family guy.M3GAN that will get me to give a 5 star
Title: Love this service

Content: Why change the color from a purple to an ugly blue that every other streaming service has (aside from Hulu). Why change something that was fine to begin with.
Title: Why?

Content: I liked that it was still HBO purple because they’re already are a lot of apps that use.Disney, Paramount, and Amazon prime all has blue. The purple HBO set it apart.The content is still great, of course.
Title: I don’t like the color change.

Content: I love this app but hbo max was a better app honesty even with all its flaws, There was more info and credits and trailers available and the rewind and fast forward feature was better before.  Also it seems the streaming errors and glitches have only gotten worse and more frequent and it kinda upsets me that the only reason why I had so many issues with hbo max recently was because the company decided to make the terrible decision of transitioning their name and app to Max and making all their customers suffer and pay for it. I never have this problem with Hulu, Netflix, peacock.. not even freevee!!? You’d think a high quality company owned by Warner bros would know how to make a functioning app like all the other competitors??  I’d rather have a functioning app with less programs at that point. MAX honestly hasn’t wowed me since I still watch the same programs I watched on the hbo app… and they’re still missing a lot of programs from hbo, Cinemax and Cartoon Network?? I’m kinda tired of excuses about licensing when plenty of people pay good money to watch HBO and Cinemax????
Title: COULD BE SO MUCH BETTER!! And I’m not asking for much?

Content: Before, with HBO Max, there were no issues at all for me. I could access it through my android TV and outside of the US. Now it says I can’t download it in my android TV AND I can’t watch in my region. Absolutely ridiculous. Max people I highly recommend you fix this or you’ll lose a major part if your clientele .
Title: Not available in android or outside of the US

Content: This switch was so dumb and pointless. Even just the fact that the only menu options are “search”, “home”, and “my stuff” is pissing me off. Bring back being able to see what’s just added and last chance!!
Title: Bring back hbo max

Content: Amazing show selection but since the switch to max they removed everything that separated the platform from other streaming services and made it original, there used to be a shuffle option which id never seen before on a streaming service and i actually used a lot and honestly i thought was unfinished and couldve been expanded on and i was beyond disappointed when i saw they removed it. Another original feature was custom profile avatars, theyve since switched to the exact same format as every other platform, this wasnt a huge loss but disappointing nonetheless. The color switch is super uncomfortable going from a calm purple to an extreme blue just hurts my eyes. Also they removed the categories and recommendations just feels less personal.  Still good show selection but honestly i could just go to hulu since they have the same stuff. Bring back shuffle mane that was dope.
Title: Removed the cool stuff :(

Content: I didn’t really care one way or the other how HBO was changing. The only thing I cared about was getting logged in. Husband loaded up Max through our FireStick, and it logged him right in. Great. I tried to login through my phone. Nothing. It suddenly won’t take my password or username. I don’t know if this is because I go through my internet provider for HBO, but this is beyond frustrating that I can’t even login.

Also, if you have a favorite series and you like to re-watch episodes, rather than starting from the beginning, when you click on a watched episode, it will start from the very end and make you perform a separate action to restart just like Hulu. Not a fan of this at all. In fact, that’s why I started watching shows like Rick and Morty on HBO Max but I guess it it doesn’t matter where I watch it now.

Content: they made the experience much more agonizing.. i used to have the ad free one for $15. it was janky the U.I. was sloppy but worked more or less… we switched to the $10 options with ads. it wasn’t bad there were only single ads at the beginning of each episode.. now with “MAX” they have absolutely ruined it much like hulu has zzz each episode is flooded in ads practically every 10-15 mins… i might as well watch TV… how awful… this update is absolutely terrible. i hope you guys are happy you have destroyed what little confidence your customers had in this company all for the sake to squeeze out a few more dollars from company’s ads all to please your thirsty shareholders. i hope this company fails as it rightfully should. thank you for letting your loyal customer base down…. not to mention the new updates U.I. IS ABSOLUTELY UTTER TRASH… an absolute mess you guys have made of this… slowly becoming netflix losing subscribers by the millions. you all deserve it… how shameful it is.

Content: It was a pain in the butt to delete the old app and get this new one. I don’t know why they couldn’t just change the name and let us carry on without having to download a new app and sign in again. But luckily, once you do that, everything is the same as far as I can see. My list appears to be completely in tact, and they remembered everything I was in the middle of watching. Overall I rate this app better than any other, with Netflix a close second and Disney+ third. All the other streaming services are lame.

Content: I paid 15.99 on hbo max on the 17 of May I have the payment showing on my banking information I have a confirmation email from y’all saying I subscribed. On the App Store it shows my subscription renews on June 17th and I called y’all and y’all said there’s no history of my subscription on May 17th. Yesterday morning I was on hbo max watching shows then I downloaded the new MAX app and an option popped up to switch over my subscription which I agreed to and it didn’t switch over. I have no issue logging in I called apple which y’all told me to do and the payment went through on their end they didn’t mess anything up and I’ve been using hbo max until yesterday morning. How can y’all send confirmation emails of a subscription to my email and then tell me I don’t have a subscription real weird y’all just want more and more money just like every streaming company and big corporations ridiculous. FIX THIS!!!!! I JUST WANT TO WATCH THE VAMPIRE DIARIES.

Embarrassingly bad app. All this work for nothing other than requesting $200/yr.

Also, not sure about the iOS app, but I'm assuming these stupid changes are on here too.. Bring back the option to choose different colors instead of forcing us to pick character icons. And bring back the ability to add an "&" to a username. Also bring back the purple!

Also, those wouldn’t be such a problem if you didnt change the color of your interface and app to a blue, opposing the purple you were so well known for. Amazon and Disney are blue, Netflix is red, Hulu green, you should’ve stayed with what you had.

So, once this tweak is made, I can affirm it’s a great app.
Title: Surprisingly Good But…

Content: I understand this isn’t HBO Max anymore, but the color change makes a huge difference from feeling “prestige” to feeling bland. 90% of streaming services and social media apps are a blue color, and HBO Max set itself apart with a royal, regal, prestigious deep purple. This new branding and color now just looks like another Amazon prime, Facebook, pandora, run of the mill other app. Nothing to differentiate itself anymore. The color changed cheapened the brand, as silly as that may sound

Title: Disaster.

Content: I have used the HBO Max app for multiple years and loved how much more organized and easy to use the interface was. The biggest disappointment was that the neatly organized hubs have been removed. No more organized Adult Swim collection, no more sorting for all the Studio Ghibli etc. now we have this weird Amazon blue themed mess with a home button and a search button. Why they went out of their way to remove functioning stable features is beyond me. They could have just removed HBO from the name and called it a day.   To add salt to the wound the app only plays audio with a black screen on my Apple TV. And no using the old app because that’s been shut down. So I guess I have to cancel my subscription until it’s actually a service again. Not really worth paying for just the audio of my favorite shows.

Really miss the purple background - designers thinking “hey, what’s the most generic sad blue background we have?” 🤮 The “brand spotlight” is hidden in the search menu on iOS. Don’t get me started on how sluggish and the lag within the app using on the newest Apple TV 4K. …what did you write this with? Content: 1.  Quit Changing Your Name.  I started calling you HBO.  To eliminate any more fkg name changes. 2. I am NOT going to update you on my IPad.  You have NOTHING to watch anyway except the Gold Digger show that I watch.  But now I can’t watch it wo the FORCED UPDATE. 3.  I can watch Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, STARZ, Apple TV, Sling tv w Dvr. Hulu, YouTube, Pluto, PLEX & a bunch of others.  I am not forced to update. Especially when you have nothing to watch. 4.  Give me a fkg break. 5. Now, I’ll cancel.

Content: Instead of simply updating the existing app, they issued a new Max app.  Besides losing profile images (no big deal), it also starts out with none of your downloads.  Why couldn’t they simply have updated the app — especially in light of the claim that the transition would be seamless.
Title: Pain in the butt transition

Content: This application adds nothing to the original What I did notice it eliminated the series Without a Trace This was suppposed to go throughMay 31 but i guess they enjoy lying to us.It will be probably such as slow to stream on TV
Title: Disappointed

Content: When I attempt to connect through provider I get a 403 error and when I use my hbomax.com credentials I solve a puzzle then get an unknown error. Both errors tell me to “try again later”
Title: Can’t login

Content: Received a 403 error code when trying to sign in via my cable provider.
Title: Error code

Content: Cannot login with existing HBO Max account with Hulu. CEO’s didn’t need to make this change for penny-pinching reasons.
Title: Waste Everyone’s Time

Content: Tells me to download the new app refuses to accept username and password
Title: Day one bugs

Content: Just keep getting an error code saying the server is down
Title: Unable to sign in

Content: if I find out y’all support Israel that five star rating will go to a zero. FREE PALESTINEEEEE!!!!!!!!!
Title: rate

Content: max app is to streaming what hiccups are to a person.  on a secure, private internet connection, software is current, streaming / casting skips and pauses more than a 6 yr old.  wish smooth playback were valued over flash ads.  i miss the quality of HBO content…max really killed the brand
Title: max please

Content: I love the shows and movies that on here when I have to go to sleep
Title: HBO max

Content: 1.  Quit Changing Your Name.  I started calling you HBO.  To eliminate any more fkg name changes. 2. I am NOT going to update you on my IPad.  You have NOTHING to watch anyway except the Gold Digger show that I watch.  But now I can’t watch it wo the FORCED UPDATE. 3.  I can watch Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, STARZ, Apple TV, Sling tv w Dvr. Hulu, YouTube, Pluto, PLEX & a bunch of others.  I am not forced to update. Especially when you have nothing to watch. 4.  Give me a fkg break. 5. Now, I’ll cancel.
Title: Bad

Content: I pay $20 a month just to have ads play before my show. No thanks.
Title: No

Content: This app specifically, is more than what anyone could ask for. It’s user friendly, and like any other streaming services, there are the latest new movies/ shows. I like this app because for the most part it has my favorite tv shows/ movies/series.
Title: User friendly
